0.title: UP Police releases pics of 40 suspects involved in Kanpur clashes, seeks info
0.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police has released photographs of 40 men in connection with the clashes and stone-pelting reported in Kanpur on Friday. Police suspect that these men played an active role in the violence, that left several injured. Police have put out a contact number and assured that the identity of those providing information regarding the individuals will be kept confidential.

1.title: 3 die, over 60 hospitalised after drinking contaminated water in K'taka
1.article_body: Three people died and at least 62 others, including 23 children, were admitted to hospital after allegedly drinking contaminated water over the last week in Raichur town of Karnataka. CM Basavaraj Bommai has announced ₹5-lakh aid for the families of the deceased. As per local health officials, the pipe supplying water is suspected to have been linked with drain water.

2.title: PIL seeking CBI probe into KK's death filed in Calcutta High Court
2.article_body: A Public Interest Litigation (PIL) has been filed in Calcutta High Court seeking a probe by CBI into late singer KK's demise. A second PIL has also been filed in the court demanding further investigation of the death by an independent agency alleging mismanagement at his final concert. KK passed away aged 53 following a live performance on May 31.

3.title: 7-yr-old girl injured during shooting practice in camp in Thane
3.article_body: Five people, including two National Cadet Corps (NCC) personnel, were booked after a 7-year-old girl was injured in an accidental firing incident during a training camp in Thane district, the police said on Sunday. The incident took place during firing practice at the camp. The girl has been admitted to Mumbai's JJ Hospital in a serious condition, an official said.

4.title: Need to make Indian banks, currency important part of international trade: PM
4.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday said it is necessary to focus on how to make our domestic banks and currency an important part of the international supply chain and trade. PM Modi inaugurated the 'Iconic Week Celebrations' by the Ministry of Finance and Corporate Affairs as part of the 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav'.

5.title: Hindi is language of underdeveloped states, will make us 'Shudras': TN MP
5.article_body: Tamil Nadu MP TKS Elangovan has alleged that attempts were being made to "impose Manu dharma through the imposition of Hindi", adding that Hindi is the language of underdeveloped states. "What will Hindi do? Only make us Shudras. It will do no benefit to us," he added. Several leaders criticised the DMK leader over his remarks.

6.title: Stones pelted between 2 groups after biker accidentally hits man in Agra
6.article_body: Clashes between two communities erupted in Uttar Pradesh's Agra after a bike rider slipped on an under-construction road and accidentally hit a passerby in Tajganj, police said. An argument took place between the two persons, which escalated to stone-pelting between local groups, police added. "A heavy police force was deployed and the situation was brought under control," Agra SSP said.

7.title: Who is Angelo Moriondo, 'godfather of espresso machines' honoured by Google?
7.article_body: Google Doodle on Monday paid tribute to Angelo Moriondo, the 'godfather of espresso machines', on his 171st birthday. The Italian inventor is credited for patenting the first known espresso machine in 1884. Moriondo's machine consisted of a large boiler that pushed heated water through coffee grounds, with a second boiler producing steam to flash the coffee and complete the brew.

8.title: Film on India's Recycle Man Binish Desai in the works
8.article_body: A film on the life of environmentalist Dr Binish Desai, known as the 'Recycle Man of India', is under development. "[It'll] be...world's first mainstream Bollywood movie which will revolve around a change maker's journey working towards eliminating the idea of waste," Desai said. The biopic will aim at promoting sustainability with a carbon-negative approach throughout its making, makers said.

9.title: Why no arrest has been made yet?: Owaisi over Nupur Sharma's remarks
9.article_body: Following Nupur Sharma’s controversial remarks against Prophet Muhammad, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi asked, "Why there is still no arrest against the spokesperson (now suspended)?" He added that instant action is taken when someone speaks or tweets against PM Narendra Modi but no action has been taken against Sharma who "insulted Prophet Muhammad".

10.title: Cong worker out on bail in 2 murder cases shoots wife dead in MP
10.article_body: A Congress party worker who is currently on bail in two murder cases, including that of his sister, allegedly shot his wife to death in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior on Sunday, police said. The accused, identified as Rishabh Bhadoriya, allegedly killed his wife in front of their children on suspicion of infidelity. Bhadoriya is currently absconding, police added.

11.title: Russia plans to restart telescope Germany shut over Ukraine war
11.article_body: Russia's space agency head Dmitry Rogozin has said that he's given instructions for restarting German telescope eROSITA "despite Germany's demand" that it should be shut down. Earlier, a German institute shut the telescope in protest over the Ukraine war. People "don't have a moral right to halt this research...just because their pro-fascist views are close to our enemies", he claimed.

12.title: We need to give our youth arms training: Akal Takht Jathedar
12.article_body: Akal Takht Jathedar Giani Harpreet Singh while addressing people on Operation Bluestar anniversary on Monday said, "We need to...give [our youth] arms training." He also called on Sikh organisations to encourage youth in Punjab to do so. Moreover, he objected to churches in the state's villages and added, "Sikh preachers must come out of...AC rooms...It's time to go to villages."

13.title: 5 booked for making casteist remarks against doctor in UP
13.article_body: Police have booked five people, including two doctors, for hurling casteist remarks at a doctor in Pratapgarh Medical College, Uttar Pradesh. In his complaint, Dr Sachin Pasi alleged that Dr Jai Prakash Verma hurled casteist remarks against him when the former opposed Verma for taking patients to his private clinic. Notably, four others were booked for supporting the casteist remarks.

14.title: Nadal's 14th French Open, 22nd Slam win at 36 is incredible: Tendulkar
14.article_body: Congratulating Rafael Nadal following his 14th French Open win, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "To go out there and win a record 14th French Open and 22nd Grand Slam at the age of 36 is an incredible achievement." Shoaib Malik said, "Mate you defy the odds every-time, age really is just a number for you! Keep going strong, champion."

15.title: BJP leaders trained in 'hate politics' by PM Modi: AAP's Sanjay Singh
15.article_body: AAP leader Sanjay Singh said in 75 years, no one has "bowed India's head in shame" as much as PM Narendra Modi. "BJP leaders and spokespersons make mistakes because they're trained in hate politics by PM Modi and the whole country bears the consequences," Singh added. His remarks came a day after BJP suspended its national spokesperson Nupur Sharma.

16.title: IAF aircraft to transport bodies of those killed in U'khand bus mishap to MP
16.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that Indian Air Force (IAF) aircraft has been arranged to transport the bodies of pilgrims killed in the bus accident in Uttarakhand to Madhya Pradesh. Chouhan said that the bodies will be sent to MP's Khajuraho after postmortem. "Our teams will be ready...and will take...the bodies to four different villages," he added.

17.title: Video shows Radhika Merchant's dance at event hosted by Mukesh & Nita Ambani
17.article_body: Videos of Anant Ambani's fiancee Radhika Merchant's Arangetram dance performance on Sunday have been shared online. Merchant was seen performing her debut Bharatanatyam dance after finishing her formal training during an event hosted by Anant's parents Mukesh and Nita Ambani at Jio World Centre in Mumbai. Actors Salman Khan, Aamir Khan and Ranveer Singh also attended the performance.

18.title: He's taken right method, but format is wrong: RP Singh on Kohli's form
18.article_body: Ex-India pacer RP Singh has said Virat Kohli is taking time to come back to his form because he's playing more T20 cricket where the scope of consuming deliveries is less. "You can start by scoring 60(55)...you can't expect to score 100(55)," Singh added. "Kohli has taken the right method but the format is wrong," he further said.

19.title: He is recovering at home: Bobby on rumours of Dharmendra being critical in hospital
19.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol has refuted rumours that his father, veteran actor Dharmendra, is critical in a hospital. "He is absolutely fine. He is at home and he is recovering. He is doing well. Thank you so much for your love and affection," Bobby said. Dharmendra was hospitalised last month following a muscle spasm.

20.title: Atmosphere of threat being propagated in state: Pilot on Moosewala’s death
20.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot on Monday met late Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala’s family in Mansa. "It's tragic how our leader was killed. An atmosphere of threat is being propagated in state repetitively," Pilot said. "The Centre and state government should probe it (death) and take strict action," he stated. "Such an incident happened to instil fear in people," Pilot added.

21.title: Bangkok celebrates its 1st LGBTQ+ Pride march in 16 years
21.article_body: Bangkok on Sunday marked its first LGBTQ+ Pride march in the last 16 years. The event, named 'Naruemit Pride 2022' was held with support from Governor of Bangkok Chadchart Sittipunt and witnessed participation from thousands of people, who waved rainbow flags on the streets. Two bills on LGBTQ+ unions are waiting to go to the parliament in Thailand, Reuters reported.

22.title: ED raids on Satyendra Jain are an act of torture: Sanjay Singh
22.article_body: AAP MP Sanjay Singh has criticised the Enforcement Directorate raids at Delhi Health Minister Satyendra Jain's residence. "This is an act of torture, not an act of raid because Jain has been questioned for five days. He is an honest person," Singh said. "Whatever Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal said today is the training of the BJP itself," he added.

23.title: Lalu to go abroad for kidney transplant, requests court to release passport
23.article_body: RJD chief and former Bihar CM Lalu Prasad Yadav has filed an application at a special CBI court in Ranchi, seeking the release of his passport for renewal as he has to go abroad for a kidney transplant. Yadav's lawyer said, most likely, the former will go to Singapore. "Process for an appointment with the doctor...is underway," the lawyer added.

24.title: Suspension not enough, send them to jail: Mayawati after BJP expels members
24.article_body: A day after BJP members Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal were suspended over remarks hurting religious sentiments, BSP chief Mayawati called for their arrest. "Only suspension is not enough, they must be jailed under strict laws," she wrote on Twitter. She said that objectionable language should not be used against any religion and the BJP must rein in its members.

25.title: I had auditioned for 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi': Ayushmann
25.article_body: Ayushmann Khurrana revealed in an interview that he had auditioned for a role in 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi'. "Actually, I made it as an RJ by the time I auditioned for the show. So I told...casting director 'Bro, I'm going'. So I couldn't do that...show," he added. Ayushmann further said the role eventually went to Pulkit Samrat.

26.title: BMC plans to rebuild old bridges in Mumbai's eastern suburbs
26.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) plans to reconstruct old bridges and widen new ones in Mumbai's eastern suburbs. The project is estimated to cost ₹51.17 crore and expected to be completed in 18 months, excluding the monsoon. "The process of appointing a contractor for executing the work has also been initiated," a BMC official said.

27.title: Man kills self in Gurugram hotel; 5-page suicide note blames wife, her family
27.article_body: A 31-year-old man died by suicide in a hotel room in Gurugram. Police said a five-page suicide note has been recovered from the man. Police added that in the suicide note, the man accused his wife and her family of harassing him and threatening to file a case against him. The victim's brother said he was under lot of stress.

28.title: Migrants from Delhi main reason behind Nagpur's COVID-19 surge: Minister
28.article_body: Amid rising COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra, state minister Nitin Raut said, "Main reason behind rising coronavirus cases in Nagpur is migrants coming from Delhi." Raut claimed most of the 35 cases traced on Monday are from Delhi. "I feel we should do [contact] tracing at airport itself and make maximum efforts for testing in urban and rural areas," he added.

29.title: Actresses have reached out to me to praise my work, it's motivating: Kiara
29.article_body: Kiara Advani revealed that whenever she likes any contemporary's performance in a film, she gets her number to praise her performance even if she doesn't know her personally. "That's happened with me as well, when other actresses have reached out to me, even those I don't know, to tell me how much they enjoyed my work...It's so motivating," she added.

30.title: Not followed Waqar; my idols include Bumrah, Shami & Bhuvneshwar: Umran
30.article_body: Fast bowler Umran Malik said he has not followed ex-Pakistan pacer Waqar Younis. "I have a natural action. My idols include (Jasprit) Bumrah, (Mohammed) Shami and Bhuvneshwar (Kumar)," he added. "I used to follow them when I was playing while coming through the ranks," he stated. Umran was named in Team India squad for the T20I series against South Africa.

31.title: 18-year-old Coco jumps to career-best 13th, Nadal moves to 4th in rankings
31.article_body: American tennis player Coco Gauff has jumped 10 spots to be ranked 13th, her career-best in the WTA rankings. Coco entered her maiden Grand Slam final in the recently-concluded French Open, where she lost the final to Iga Swiatek. Meanwhile, Rafael Nadal, who won the men's singles French Open title, moved one spot to be ranked fourth.

32.title: Maha schools to reopen on June 15; masks not mandatory: Minister
32.article_body: Schools in Maharashtra will reopen on June 15 with COVID-19-appropriate measures regardless of the rising cases, state School Education Minister Varsha Gaikwad said on Monday. She said masks are not mandatory and new SOPs will be issued to schools. Further decisions will be taken in accordance with the situation, she added.

33.title: Delving into new character is like being a tourist in new country: Rogowski
33.article_body: German actor Franz Rogowski has said delving into a new character is like being a tourist in a new country. "In...beginning, you start taking pictures of...place you're visiting. Then, you go to restaurants, " he said, adding, "After a couple of days, you start looking at...narrow lanes and dusty market areas. Bit by bit, you start having real experiences."

34.title: Lavrov forced to cancel Serbia visit as 3 countries close airspace
34.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov was forced to cancel his visit to Serbia after three of the latter country's neighbours, Bulgaria, North Macedonia and Montenegro, closed their airspace to the aircraft carrying the minister. A ministry spokesperson confirmed the news during a broadcast on a TV channel, Russian news agency TASS reported. Earlier, Serbia secured a gas deal with Russia.

35.title: Expecting bit of spin, but pitch not dry square: Finch on Lankan surfaces
35.article_body: Australian skipper Aaron Finch has commented on the type of pitches that will be on offer on their tour to Sri Lanka which starts from Tuesday. "Expecting there to be a bit of spin there but it might be tacky...It's not a dry square," Finch said. He added, "There will be a lot of sun over the next 24 hours."

36.title: Should be in Limca Book of Records: Sule over raids on 'Deshmukh family'
36.article_body: Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik and ex-Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh have not done anything but are "stuck" in jail, NCP MP Supriya Sule said. "109 times raid on Deshmukh family should make it to Limca Book of Records," Sule added. "Today or tomorrow, the court will give them a clean chit. Whoever speaks against the Centre is raided," Sule stated.

37.title: Rahul Gandhi to meet Moosewala's family in Mansa on Tuesday
37.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi will meet the late singer Sidhu Moosewala's family in the latter's native village in Punjab's Mansa district on Tuesday. Notably, this will be Gandhi's first meeting with the family since Moosewala's assassination. Gandhi had condoled on the demise of the 28-year-old singer-turned politician who was shot dead by assailants last month.

38.title: Rohit Shetty starts shooting for 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12', shares video
38.article_body: Rohit Shetty has started shooting for the stunt-based reality show 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12' in Cape Town, South Africa. The filmmaker, who hosts the show, took to Instagram on Monday to share a video where he is seen in a helicopter. "Time to go crazy, wild...and real once again! Khatron Ke Khiladi!! Shoot begins," Rohit wrote while sharing the video.

39.title: 8 suspected sharp shooters who killed Sidhu Moosewala identified, pics released
39.article_body: Punjab Police have identified the eight suspected sharp shooters who allegedly killed singer Sidhu Moosewala. They belong to Punjab, Haryana, Rajasthan and Maharashtra. They are Manpreet Singh Mannu, Jagroop Singh Roopa and Harkamal alias Ranu from Punjab, Priyavrat Fauji and Manjeet alias Bholu from Haryana, Saurav Mahakal and Santosh Jadhav from Pune and Subhash Banuda from Rajasthan.

40.title: Video of Joe Root's bat standing on its own goes viral, fan says 'What is this sorcery?'
40.article_body: A video of ex-England captain Joe Root's bat standing on its own when the batter was at the non-striker's end has gone viral on social media. Reacting to the video, a fan tweeted, "I knew @root66 was talented but not as magic as this...What is this sorcery?" Another fan wrote, "His bat is unusually square & flat at the bottom."

41.title: Layer'r Shot apologises for controversial ads accused of promoting rape culture
41.article_body: Layer'r Shot has apologised after facing criticism over its advertisements, which were accused of promoting rape culture. "We never intended to hurt anyone’s sentiments...or outrage any woman’s modesty, or promote any sort of culture, as wrongly perceived by some," it said. "We...apologise for...advertisements that consequentially caused rage amongst individuals and several communities."

42.title: Delhi Police books unknown persons for sending death threats to Nupur Sharma
42.article_body: Delhi Police has registered an FIR against unknown persons for allegedly threatening and harassing former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma over her alleged remarks on Prophet Muhammad during a television debate last month. "We have started an investigation and are looking into tweets and comments posted by unknown persons on Sharma's video," an officer said.

43.title: Rafael Nadal refuses retirement rumours, says 'I will keep fighting'
43.article_body: After winning his 22nd Grand Slam, Spanish tennis player Rafael Nadal denied the rumours about his retirement. "I don't know what can happen in the future. I will keep fighting to try to keep going," the 36-year-old said after winning his 14th French Open title. Nadal defeated Casper Ruud 6-3, 6-3, 6-0 in the French Open final.

44.title: Barring injury, Root will go miles past my record: Alastair Cook
44.article_body: Ex-England captain Alastair Cook, who's the highest run-scorer for England in Test cricket, has said that Joe Root will go miles past his record. "For the most complete batsmen in all three forms, it's Root. His consistency is incredible," added Cook. Root crossed the 10,000-run mark in their win against New Zealand in the first match of the three-Test series.

45.title: 15 Twitter, FB accounts booked over communal clashes in Kanpur
45.article_body: The police have booked 15 social media accounts on Twitter and Facebook for allegedly inciting people in connection to the communal clashes in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur. The violence, in which about 40 people were injured, had broken out following former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's controversial remarks on Prophet Muhammad. Earlier, 36 people were arrested following the violence.

46.title: Russian general killed in eastern Ukraine: Report
46.article_body: A Russian state media journalist on Sunday said that a Russian general was killed in eastern Ukraine. However, the report didn't say precisely when and where Major General Roman Kutuzov was killed. Notably, Russia already classifies military deaths as state secrets even in times of peace and hasn't updated its official casualty figures in Ukraine since March 25.

47.title: Calendar Grand Slam will motivate Nadal to keep going: Henman
47.article_body: Tim Henman said the chance to complete the Calendar Grand Slam will motivate Rafael Nadal to play at Wimbledon and beyond. Earlier, Nadal said he'd play at Wimbledon only if his body allowed it. Nadal has won first two Grand Slams of the year for the first time in his career following his record-extending 14th French Open title on Sunday.

48.title: Pune adequately prepared if COVID-19 cases rise: PMC health chief
48.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation's Health Department chief Dr Ashish Bharati said the civic body is adequately prepared if COVID-19 cases rise. "There are at least 800-900 beds across PMC-run hospitals…Around 1,000-1,200 tests are being conducted daily in the city as the number of new cases has gone up slightly," he added. Maharashtra reported over 1,400 new COVID-19 cases on Sunday.

49.title: Man impersonates police to rob senior citizens in Hyd, nabbed
49.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police nabbed an auto driver who'd impersonated a police officer to carry out theft on Saturday. The accused, identified as Ramavath Naresh, would reportedly 'summon' senior citizens to the police station after threatening them with false cases and rob them once they boarded his auto. Police seized materials worth ₹80,000, including gold ornaments, from Naresh's possession.

50.title: Delhi Police to reward 2 Army aspirants for chasing down thieves escaping in auto
50.article_body: Two Army aspirants chased down mobile phone snatchers who were trying to escape in an autorickshaw and managed to recover the device after a fight. The duo will be awarded a commendation certificate and given ₹2,000 each as a reward by Delhi Police. There was a scuffle between the two sides and the complainant and his friend sustained minor injuries.

51.title: PhonePe is a made in India company, we will list in India: CEO
51.article_body: PhonePe Founder and CEO Sameer Nigam told CNN News-18 that it is moving its holding company from Singapore to India and plans to launch an IPO in India. "We are a made in India company. Every office, data centre, and employee of ours is here. There's no reason why we shouldn't contribute to wealth creation in this market," Nigam said.

52.title: Kartik shares 'Ami Je Tomar' rock version as 'Bhool...' crosses ₹150cr
52.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan on Monday took to social media to share the rock version of 'Ami Je Tomar' as his film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' crossed the ₹150 crore mark at the Indian box office. He wrote alongside the video, "150 cr india mein... aur toh aur 200 cr Worldwide ho gaye hain doston. Meri Khushi ka thikana nahi hai."

53.title: Russia shouldn't shut US embassy, dialogue must continue: Envoy
53.article_body: The US ambassador to Moscow, John Sullivan, has said that Russia must not close the American embassy. The statement comes amid growing hostilities between the two countries over the Ukraine war. "We must preserve the ability to speak to each other," said Sullivan. "We can't just break off diplomatic relations and stop talking to each other," he added.

54.title: How the IPL performers play for India in SA T20Is will matter: Raina
54.article_body: Ex-India batter Suresh Raina has said the upcoming T20I series against South Africa will be important for the IPL performers who have been selected in the squad. "How they perform for India will matter. The mindset is important if you have to play for India," he stated. India will play five-match T20I series against South Africa, starting on June 9.

55.title: Wishing you success in the coming year: Pujara on Rahane's b'day
55.article_body: India batter Cheteshwar Pujara took to Twitter to wish batter Ajinkya Rahane on his 34th birthday. "A very happy birthday brother Rahane. Wishing you happiness and success in the coming year. Enjoy your day," he tweeted. Harbhajan Singh also wished Rahane on his birthday. Taking to Twitter, Harbhajan wrote, "Happy birthday Rahane...Have a fabulous year ahead."

56.title: No change in existing banknotes: RBI on reports it may use Tagore, Kalam's pics
56.article_body: The RBI has denied reports that it is considering changes to the existing currency and banknotes by replacing the face of Mahatma Gandhi with that of others. The RBI on Monday clarified that there will be no change in existing currency and banknotes. Earlier, reports said that RBI is considering using Rabindranath Tagore and APJ Abdul Kalam's pictures on banknotes.

57.title: Chopped pieces of body found in gunny bag in Delhi, head & torso missing
57.article_body: Chopped pieces of a body were found in a gunny bag in an open field near the Kalyanpuri area in East Delhi on Sunday. The head and torso were missing, police said, adding that the body was in such a state that it was impossible to ascertain the gender. Police said it appears that the murder took place somewhere else.

58.title: We were living in shock, Vicky was told to leave me: Ankita on Sushant's death
58.article_body: Actress Ankita Lokhande said that she and her husband Vicky Jain were living in state of shock after late actor Sushant Singh Rajput's death. She said that social media turned abusive towards Vicky and he was told to leave her. "Had it been some other guy, he would have quit, but Vicky stood there and became my strength," she added.

59.title: Scarlett wins Best Hero, Tom wins Best Performance at MTV Awards
59.article_body: Actress Scarlett Johansson won the Best Hero award for 'Black Widow' at the 2022 MTV Movie & TV Awards. Actor Tom Holland was awarded Best Performance in a Movie for 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'. 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' also won the Best Movie award and 'Euphoria' was declared Best Show. Actress Zendaya won Best Performance in a Show for 'Euphoria'.

60.title: China eases COVID-19 curbs in Beijing; cinemas, restaurants open
60.article_body: China lifted several COVID-19 restrictions in Beijing on Monday as the number of cases declined. While restaurants can resume dine-in services, cinemas have been allowed to open with a limited capacity of 75%. Public transport has also resumed in most districts. The city didn't report any domestically transmitted infection in the last 15 hours, an official said on Monday.

61.title: La Liga is a good league for Lewandowski, it is more technical: Pires
61.article_body: Former Arsenal player Robert Pires has said that Robert Lewandowski's move to Barcelona is his "last chance for another great contract". He further said that La Liga is a good league for Lewandowski. "Mainly because he would have even more freedom in Spain compared to the Bundesliga; La Liga is more technical, it seems perfect for him," he stated.

62.title: CCTV video shows man taking selfie with Sidhu Moosewala on day of murder; probe ordered
62.article_body: A CCTV footage purportedly showing a man taking selfies with Sidhu Moosewala on the day he was shot dead has surfaced online. The video shows a group of men standing in front of the singer's car when the man approached him for selfie. Police has reportedly launched a probe, suspecting two of these men informed the shooters after Moosewala left.

63.title: PFI activists stopped during march towards Kerala CM's house, water cannons fired
63.article_body: Popular Front of India activists marched towards state Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan's residence on Monday. PFI activists were stopped and water cannons and tear gas were used to disperse them, reports said. This comes after ED attached 33 PFI bank accounts with ₹68 lakh in a money laundering case. ED also said that PFI raised funds from China.

64.title: Ukrainian Prez Zelenskyy visits war frontlines, thanks soldiers
64.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday reached at the frontline positions close to where intense fighting is going on. He met and thanked his troops fighting the war against Russian forces. "I want to thank you for your great work, for your service, for protecting all of us, our state. I am grateful to everyone," he told them.

65.title: Ukrainian troops burned tonnes of grains before leaving Mariupol: DPR
65.article_body: An official of the separatist Donetsk People's Republic, Yan Gagin, said that the Ukrainian soldiers set fire to tonnes of grains of corn and wheat kept in storage facilities at Mariupol seaport before leaving. "Judging by the smell and appearance, it is unsuitable for further use," Gagin said. The grains cannot even be used as cattle feed, he added.

66.title: 2 minors raped in Hyd in separate incidents, accused arrested
66.article_body: Cases of sexual assault on two minor girls in Hyderabad were reported on Sunday, days after a 17-year-old girl was allegedly gangraped in city's Jubillee Hills area. In first case, police arrested two accused, a taxi driver and his friend, for allegedly sexually abusing an 11-year-old girl. In second incident, a 21-year-old was arrested for kidnapping and raping minor girl.

67.title: Jennifer Lopez wins Generation Award at 2022 MTV Movie & TV Awards
67.article_body: Actress-singer Jennifer Lopez was honoured with the Generation Award at the 2022 MTV Movie & TV Awards given to actors whose diverse contributions have made them household names. In her speech, she thanked her fans, manager and children for "teaching [her] to love". Jennifer also won the award for best song for 'On My Way' from the 'Marry Me' soundtrack.

68.title: Indian expat finds ₹2cr in Dubai elevator, honoured for handing it over to police
68.article_body: An Indian expatriate was honoured in Dubai for handing over money found in an elevator to the police. Tariq Mahmood Khalid Mahmood handed over 1 million Dirhams (around ₹2.11 crore) at the Al Barsha Police Station. The Director of the police station said, "His (Mahmood's) morals represent the noble values of our society that we're very proud of."

69.title: PM launches new series of coins, says 'it will remind people of goal of amrit kal'
69.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has released a special series of ₹1, ₹2, ₹5, ₹10 and ₹20 coins, featuring the 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' design. The "visually impaired friendly" coins will be a part of the circulation, the government said. PM Modi said the coins will "remind people of the goal of amrit kal" and motivate them to work towards India's development.

70.title: Anupam Kher announces his 525th project, asks fans to suggest title
70.article_body: Anupam Kher, taking to Instagram, wrote, "Today I start the landmark 525th project of my career. A beautiful story of a common man." He stated they are yet to finalise the title of the project as he, the producer, and the director have different titles. "We thought the best way to finalise is to ask you all," he wrote.

71.title: Pune sees traffic congestion as schools reopen after summer break
71.article_body: Many areas in Pune witnessed traffic congestion as schools reopened after a summer break on Monday. Traffic police officials said they asked schools to deploy their staff at entry points. "We have deployed our full strength on the roads and have also stepped patrolling in the areas with possible traffic issues," Deputy Commissioner of Police (Traffic) Rahul Shrirame said.

72.title: WB cabinet passes bill to make Mamata Chancellor of state-run universities
72.article_body: The West Bengal cabinet on Monday approved a proposal to make Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee Chancellor of all state-run universities under different departments like Health, Agriculture, Animal Husbandry and Minority Affairs. According to officials, the CM is going to replace Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar, who currently holds the post. The decision will be taken up for approval in the state Assembly.

73.title: Players selected for T20I series vs SA need leader like KL Rahul: Raina
73.article_body: Ex-India batter Suresh Raina said Team India players selected for the T20I series against South Africa need a leader like KL Rahul. Raina added, "There are new fast bowlers...Umran Malik...and...Arshdeep Singh. Both Rishabh Pant and Dinesh Karthik...will also be there...so I feel Rahul's presence will bring calmness." The first T20I will be played on June 9.

74.title: B'luru's railway terminal with airport-like facilities to start op tonight
74.article_body: The railway terminal in Bengaluru's Baiyappanahalli that will provide facilities like an airport will begin operations on Monday night. The Banaswadi-Ernakulam Express will be the first to run from the terminal at 7 pm, an official of the South Western Railway (SWR) said. It is expected that the railway terminal will be inaugurated by PM Narendra Modi later.

75.title: Former CPI (Maoist) sub-zonal commander held from jungle in Jharkhand
75.article_body: A former CPI (Maoist) sub-zonal commander was arrested by the police following a tip-off from a jungle in Jharkhand's Garhwa district. The accused, identified as Bhanu Singh Kharwar, made an attempt to escape the jungle with his lover but was intercepted by the police, the Superintendent of Police Anjani Kumar Jha said. Notably, around 10 cases were pending against Kharwar.

76.title: One of the most underrated cricketers: Sehwag on Rahane's 34th birthday
76.article_body: Former India opener Virender Sehwag took to Twitter to wish India batter Ajinkya Rahane on his 34th birthday. "One of the most underrated cricketers, and the man who led India to its greatest ever overseas Test series win. Happy Birthday Rahane," wrote Sehwag. Harbhajan also wished Rahane, tweeting, "Happy birthday Rahane. Keep smiling, [and] have a fabulous year ahead."

77.title: Truck seized in drive against sand mafia in 2018 stolen in Pune, 2 held
77.article_body: Police have arrested the owner and driver of a truck for allegedly stealing the vehicle, which was seized by government officials in 2018 for illegal sand transportation, from the tehsildar's office. The truck was again being used for illegal sand transportation. Police stated that nine trucks were attached at the Shevalwadi toll post during action against sand mafia in 2018.

78.title: 'Tumhara Moosewala kar denge,' says threat letter sent to Salman Khan
78.article_body: The threat letter received by actor Salman Khan and his father Salim Khan allegedly stated, "Tumhara Moosewala kar denge (you'll end up like Moosewala)." Salim Khan found the letter, an officer said. This comes days after Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala was shot dead in Mansa, following which police suspected role of gangster Lawrence Bishnoi and his Canada-based associate Goldy Brar.

79.title: Haasan's 'Vikram' crosses ₹100-cr mark in India, earns over ₹150 cr worldwide
79.article_body: Kamal Haasan's action thriller movie 'Vikram' has crossed the ₹100-crore mark in India within three days of its release. According to entertainment journalist Sreedhar Pillai, the Lokesh Kanagaraj directorial has collected more than ₹150 crore at the worldwide box office. As per reports, the Hindi-dubbed version of the film has earned only ₹2 crore in its first three days.

80.title: I feel ODI cricket is the most boring contest, it is struggling: Aakash Chopra
80.article_body: After ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri suggested terminating the bilateral series in T20 cricket and only playing the format in the World Cups, commentator Aakash Chopra said it's the ODI format that's struggling and needs change. "ODIs [are] the most meaningless...it's not the T20I cricket that is struggling. Let T20 internationals continue because the broadcasters [also] need them," he stated.

81.title: He will eat you alive: Ruud on playing defensive against Nadal on clay
81.article_body: Norway's Casper Ruud has commented after losing the French Open final to Spain's Rafael Nadal on Sunday. "(I) wanted to get the match going and maybe try to win the set," Ruud said. "But then he stepped up...When you are playing defensive against Rafa on clay, he will eat you alive," he added.

82.title: Your belief helped make me who I am today: Sanjay on dad's birth anniversary
82.article_body: Sanjay Dutt took to Twitter on Monday to share a post remembering his late father, actor Sunil Dutt, on his birth anniversary. He shared a collage featuring two stills from his 2003 movie 'Munna Bhai M.B.B.S'. "Your belief and love helped make me who I'm today. You were, are and will always be my hero. Happy birthday, Dad," Sanjay wrote.

83.title: Saddened, says Ex-Tripura Governor as BJP suspends Nupur Sharma
83.article_body: After BJP suspended its national spokesperson Nupur Sharma, former Governor of Tripura Tathagata Roy said he is “saddened” over the “treatment” of Sharma. “I am now an ordinary member and supporter of BJP...I have nothing to fear or expect from the BJP,” Roy added. “I support BJP because it is the closest to my thinking,” Roy stated.

84.title: Never become complacent: Kamal Haasan to 'Vikram' director Lokesh
84.article_body: 'Vikram' director Lokesh Kanagaraj took to Twitter and wrote he was "overwhelmed" by the support of the audience for his film. He wrote, "I don't know how I'm gonna repay you guys for...this love." On Twitter, Kamal Haasan replied to Lokesh's tweet and wrote, "The only way you can do any debt management with...loving audience is to never become complacent."

85.title: Tribal mangoes from Maharashtra’s Nashik exported to US for 1st time
85.article_body: In a first, tribal farmers from Maharashtra's Nashik have exported naturally-grown organic mangoes to the United States. An official said that this consignment has enabled these farmers to earn more than 200 per cent of what they earn in local markets. Reports said that the 1.2 tonne consignment was sourced from tribal growers from nine talukas of Nashik.

86.title: UK PM Boris Johnson to face no-confidence vote today
86.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson will face a no-confidence vote by lawmakers in the governing Conservative Party on Monday evening, the chairman of the 1922 Committee Graham Brady said. Reuters reported that Johnson has been under growing pressure after a report documented alcohol-fuelled parties at his Downing Street office and residence when Britain was under strict COVID-19 lockdowns.

87.title: India responds to Pakistan's reaction over former BJP leader's remark on Prophet Muhammad
87.article_body: India responded to Pakistan's reaction over ex-BJP leader Nupur Sharma's remark on Prophet Muhammad. The government said, "The Government of India accords highest respect to all religions. This is quite unlike Pakistan where fanatics are eulogized and monuments made in their honour." Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif had said, "India under [PM] Modi is trampling religious freedoms & persecuting Muslims."

88.title: Russian ministry website appears hacked, data protected: Reports
88.article_body: Russia's Ministry of Construction, Housing and Utilities website was apparently hacked, with the search results for the site showing a "Glory to Ukraine" sign in Ukrainian, Reuters reported. A ministry representative had said that while the site was down, the users' data was protected, according to state media RIA. Other media claimed that hackers had demanded ransom, RIA also reported.

89.title: Delhi Cong passes resolution to make Rahul Gandhi as party's national president
89.article_body: The Delhi unit of the Congress party has unanimously passed a resolution requesting Congress leader Rahul Gandhi to become the party's national president. "In these challenging times, only a strong leader like Rahul Gandhi...can further strengthen and rejuvenate the Congress, to expose the lies and falsehood of BJP and AAP," the resolution said.

90.title: Scorpio car hits biker and speeds off after argument in Delhi, video surfaces
90.article_body: A video showing a Scorpio car hitting a biker and speeding off following an argument between the SUV's driver and a group of bikers in Delhi has surfaced. The biker fell off his bike in the incident. "Scorpio car driver almost killed a few of our riders and threatened to kill us by crushing us under car," a biker tweeted.

91.title: LIC share price hits record low, market value falls below ₹5 lakh crore
91.article_body: Shares of Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) hit record low on Monday after falling nearly 2%. The state-run insurer's shares fell to an all-time low of ₹782.50 on the NSE and its market capitalisation fell below ₹5 lakh crore. Notably, LIC had become India's fifth-largest company after listing on May 17, with a market value of ₹5.70 lakh crore.

92.title: Don't make my address public, getting death threats: BJP's Naveen Jindal
92.article_body: The Bharatiya Janata Party's (BJP) Delhi media cell head, Naveen Kumar Jindal, who was expelled by the party over his remarks against Prophet Muhammad, said he and his family members are receiving death threats. "I have a special request to all, please do not make my address public," he wrote on Twitter. He also asked Delhi Police to take note.

93.title: Woman, her son go to wash clothes, drown in river in Pune
93.article_body: A woman and her son drowned in a river in Pune's Naigaon after they went there to wash clothes on Sunday. The woman drowned while trying to save her son, who had fallen into the water. The woman's bother and a relative brought the duo out and rushed them to a hospital where they were declared brought dead.

94.title: A lot of heat in TV studios, no major riots in past 10 yrs in India: Sadhguru
94.article_body: There is "a lot of heat" in television studios which suggests there is rising religious intolerance in country, Sadhguru said. He added, we haven't heard of any major communal riots in India in past 10 years. "These things have come down significantly in last 25 years," Sadhguru said. "I think we tend to exaggerate things quite a bit," he stated.

95.title: Boney has helped me, gave me 'Wanted' when time was not in my favour: Salman
95.article_body: Salman Khan, during the International Indian Film Academy Awards (IIFA) in Abu Dhabi, credited producer Boney Kapoor for reviving his career with the film 'Wanted'. "Boney Kapoor has helped me throughout my life. When the time was not in my favour, he gave me 'Wanted', which got me back," he said. The film, directed by Prabhudheva, was released in 2009.

96.title: Sub-inspector sexually exploits stepdaughter, wife's sister in B'luru; booked
96.article_body: A sub-inspector has been booked for allegedly sexually exploiting his 13-year-old stepdaughter and his wife's sister in Bengaluru. The second wife, who'd filed a complaint against the accused, claimed that he had also forced her to have unnatural sex. The complainant said that she and the accused initially had a "harmonious life" after marriage, but it "deteriorated as times passed".

97.title: Political alliances can't be one-sided: Milind Deora on BMC wards reservation
97.article_body: After 21 of the 29 wards held by Congress were reserved for women for the upcoming Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation election, Congress leader Milind Deora has expressed his disappointment. "The greatest casualty of BMC's ward reservation has been Congress, despite being an MVA ally. Political alliances cannot be one-sided. I will raise this issue...with the party's leadership," Deora said.

98.title: BJP pushed India into dark age of religious polarisation: Congress
98.article_body: A day after Gulf countries condemned now suspended BJP spokesperson's remarks against Prophet Muhammad, Congress said that "the BJP has pushed India into a dark age of religious polarisation". It said that the BJP's statement, saying it is against any ideology which insults any religion, is farce and a sham attempt at damage control.

99.title: No rule of law in state, only a ruler: WB Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar
99.article_body: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar said he has seen a situation where there is no rule of law in the state but a "ruler". "I've seen terrible situations and challenges being a Governor. I've seen the rule going beyond the constitutional system," Dhankhar added. Furthermore, Dhankhar said the rule in West Bengal doesn't match the standards of a democratic setup.

100.title: Surat set to get India's 1st bullet train station, to be ready by 2024
100.article_body: India's first bullet train station will come up in Gujarat's Surat. The station will be completed by 2024, reports said. Minister for Railways, Ashwini Vaishnaw, visited the site on Monday to review the progress of the project. "We are trying our best to start bullet train services between Surat and Billimora in 2026," Vaishnaw said.

101.title: Viswanathan Anand defeats world chess champion Magnus Carlsen in sudden death game
101.article_body: Former world chess champion Viswanathan Anand defeated world champion Magnus Carlsen in Armageddon (sudden death game) after their regular match ended in a draw in the Classical section in the Norway Chess tournament. With the win, Anand regained the sole lead in the tournament. Earlier, Anand had defeated Carlsen in the seventh round of the blitz event of Norway Chess.

102.title: Brothers kill mother in Mumbai over not allowing marriage
102.article_body: A 42-year-old woman was allegedly killed by her two sons and the elder son's girlfriend in Mumbai's Wadala area for allegedly practising black magic and not allowing the elder son to marry his girlfriend. The elder son, Akshay (25), attacked his mother, Nirmala Thakur, with a sickle while his 15-year-old brother and girlfriend, Komal, were holding the deceased, police said.

103.title: Unwarranted & narrow-minded: India on Islamic nations' group's statement
103.article_body: India has categorically rejected Organisation of Islamic Cooperation Secretariat's "unwarranted and narrow-minded comments", adding that India accords the highest respect to all religions. "It's regrettable that OIC Secretariat has yet again chosen to make motivated, misleading and mischievous comments," India said. The OIC called upon the UN to take action against anti-Muslim practices in India.

104.title: They shouldn't take the risk of playing Hardik in ODIs: Ravi Shastri
104.article_body: Ravi Shastri said Hardik Pandya should play only T20Is before going into the T20 World Cup 2022. "Hardik has had ample rest and he will continue to have ample rest because that's the only format he should play going into the World Cup," he stated. "They shouldn't take the risk of making him play ODI cricket," he added.

105.title: Centre calling ex-BJP leaders 'fringe elements' is a joke: Cong MP
105.article_body: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh reacted to the Centre's response to Qatar and Kuwait demanding an apology over a former BJP spokesperson's remark on Prophet Muhammad, saying that the External Affairs Ministry "calling (former) BJP spokespersons 'fringe elements' is a joke". Moreover, he stated that BJP suspending Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal "is what Americans call a good cop-bad cop routine".

106.title: Why should India apologise for hate speeches of BJP bigots: KTR
106.article_body: A day after BJP suspended two spokespersons, Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal, over remarks on Prophet Muhammad amid condemnation by Gulf countries, Telangana minister KT Rama Rao said the party, not the country, should apologise. "PM Narendra Modi Ji, why should India as a country apologise to international community for the hate speeches of BJP bigots?" he tweeted.

107.title: Gunpowder for toy gun pallets suspected to be cause of Hapur blast: Victim
107.article_body: A victim of the Hapur factory blast said that gunpowder that was being used for the pallets of toy guns in the factory is suspected to have caused the explosion. However, police said that the material that caused the blast would be ascertained after the Forensic Science Laboratory investigation. Police added that plastic pallets have been recovered from the site.

108.title: I'm going to be in Wimbledon if my body is ready: Rafael Nadal
108.article_body: After winning his 22nd Grand Slam, Rafael Nadal has said that he will be a part of the Wimbledon if his body is ready. "Wimbledon is not a tournament that I want to miss. I think nobody wants to miss Wimbledon. I love Wimbledon," he stated. Nadal defeated Casper Ruud 6-3, 6-3, 6-0 to win the French Open on Sunday.

109.title: Tendulkar's record of most runs in Test cricket achievable for Root: Mark Taylor
109.article_body: Former Australia cricketer Mark Taylor has said that Sachin Tendulkar's record of most runs in Test cricket is very much achievable for England's Joe Root. "Root has a minimum of five years left in him...[and] he's in the prime of his career, so there are 15,000-plus runs for him if he stays healthy," added Taylor. Tendulkar scored 15,921 Test runs.

110.title: PM Modi has weakened environmental laws in India: Jairam Ramesh
110.article_body: Senior Congress leader Jairam Ramesh has accused PM Narendra Modi of weakening environmental and forest laws in India. "Vishguru is launching LiFE (Lifestyle for Environment)," Ramesh said. "This is maximum hypocrisy since he's (PM Modi) weakening all environmental and forest laws, regulations, and institutions at home while posing as an eco-champion on the world stage," Ramesh added.

111.title: Chris Evans, Jennifer Lopez walk red carpet at MTV Movie & TV Awards 2022
111.article_body: Chris Evans, Jennifer Lopez and Olivia Rodrigo were among the celebrities who walked the red carpet at the MTV Movie & TV Awards, which took place on Sunday at the Barker Hangar in Santa Monica. Jennifer, who was honoured with the Generation Award at the event, opted for a black dress and accessorised her look with a necklace and bracelet.

112.title: Salman Khan's security strengthened after receiving threat letter
112.article_body: Salman Khan's security has been strengthened by the Maharashtra Home Department after a threat letter was sent to him and his father Salim Khan on Sunday. As per the police, the threat letter was found by Salim's security staff on a bench. Salman's security was earlier stepped up after it emerged that Lawrence Bishnoi was involved in Sidhu Moosewala's murder.

113.title: Those who express bigotry should be aware of consequences: Tharoor on Nupur's remarks
113.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Sunday said, "Those who express bigotry at home should be aware of the consequences abroad." He was reacting to reports claiming that superstores in Saudi Arabia, Kuwait and Bahrain removed Indian products over ex-BJP leader Nupur Sharma's remarks on Prophet Muhammad. India's proud position is being undermined by the irresponsibility of the communal-minded, he added.

114.title: I'm living the life I'd never imagined: Arjun on his acting career
114.article_body: Arjun Kapoor, speaking about his acting career, said, "I'm living the life that I'd never imagined...I'm grateful...forever happy being part of this profession." He further stated he's aware of how difficult filmmaking is behind the camera. Arjun added, "The biggest lesson I learned over the years is that being in front of...camera is also as much of the hard work."

115.title: Imran Khan will be arrested once his protective bail expires: Pak Minister
115.article_body: Pakistan's Interior Minister Rana Sanaullah has said that former PM Imran Khan will be arrested once his three-week transit bail granted by a court on June 2 expires. He said that Khan is facing over two dozen cases including rioting, sedition, chaos and armed attacks. Khan had earlier called for mass agitation demanding early elections in the country.

116.title: People wanted to know who I was dating even if I'd biggest film coming: Nargis
116.article_body: Actress Nargis Fakhri said that people always wanted to know who she is dating even when her biggest film was coming out. She said that people were interested in what she was doing even when she was not in India. "I don't know if they hound other people so much," Nargis said, adding that she is not a secretive human.

117.title: S Korea, US fire 8 missiles in response to N Korean missile tests
117.article_body: South Korea and the US fired eight surface-to-surface missiles on Monday in response to North Korea launching at least eight suspected ballistic missiles, according to authorities. South Korean military said that this was done to show the "capability and posture to launch immediate precision strikes on the origins of provocation and their command and support forces", Yonhap news agency reported.

118.title: Focus is not on breaking Shoaib Akhtar's fastest delivery record: Umran
118.article_body: India's 22-year-old pacer Umran Malik, who has received his maiden Team India call-up for the South Africa T20Is, has said his focus is on bowling in the right areas and help the team win. "My focus is not on Shoaib Akhtar's fastest delivery record," he added. Akhtar bowled the fastest delivery in recorded history after clocking 161.3kmph in 2003.

119.title: The way BJP is working, country heading towards civil war: Lalu Yadav
119.article_body: RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav on Sunday said that the way BJP is working, the country is moving towards a "civil war". "I call upon the people to unite against inflation, unemployment and corruption in the country," Yadav added. "We've to fight united and we'll win…We do not have to back off," he stated.

120.title: People said, 'You'll disappear off map': Nargis on her break from acting
120.article_body: Nargis Fakhri, speaking about her break from acting, said, "There came a point when I had to ask myself, 'Why am I working...hard when I can't even enjoy the fruits of my labour?'" She added, "People were like...'You'll...disappear off the map'." Nargis said she is happy she took the break as she wasn't scared into continuing in "that rat race".

121.title: Punjab Police detain Devendra alias Kala from Haryana in Sidhu Moosewala murder case
121.article_body: Punjab Police have detained Devendra alias Kala from Haryana's Fatehabad district last night in singer Sidhu Moosewala's murder case. According to reports, Devendra allegedly provided shelter to two other murder suspects, Charanjeet and Keshav. Earlier, Punjab Police had arrested Pawan Bishnoi and Naseeb from Fatehabad district.

122.title: Chinese astronauts reach space station to finish its construction
122.article_body: Three Chinese astronauts, launched into space on Sunday, successfully reached the Tiangong space station. They have been sent to complete the construction of the space station. They will spend six months at the station, which is expected to be complete by the end of 2022. They will assemble two laboratory modules that will join the main Tianhe living space.

123.title: Salman breaks down recalling how Suniel Shetty helped him when he didn't have any money
123.article_body: Actor Salman Khan broke down at IIFA Awards recalling how Suniel Shetty helped him when he didn't have any money. Salman said that he visited Suniel's shop and could afford only a pair of jeans. Salman added Suniel gifted him a shirt and later took him home and gave him a pair of boots he was eyeing at the shop.

124.title: How does the World Test Championship points table read after England's win?
124.article_body: Following their victory against New Zealand at Lord's, England are placed eighth on the World Test Championship (WTC) points table with 19.23% of points won. Bangladesh are placed last on the table with 16.67% of points won. Meanwhile, New Zealand are placed seventh, while India are third on the points table, which is led by Australia.

125.title: Heat wave warning issued for 11 states/UTs for today and tomorrow, list released
125.article_body: The IMD has issued heat wave warning for 11 states and UT/s for today and tomorrow. Heat wave conditions are likely in Rajasthan, Punjab, Haryana, Delhi, Maharashtra, Chhattisgarh and Telangana today, the IMD said. Meanwhile, Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Jharkhand and Odisha are likely to witness heat wave conditions today and tomorrow, the IMD added.

126.title: What has Kejriwal done for Kashmiri Pandits in Delhi?: Anurag Thakur
126.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Sunday asked, "What has Arvind Kejriwal (Delhi CM and AAP national convenor) done for Kashmiri Pandits in Delhi?" His statement came after Kejriwal said BJP can’t handle Kashmir. "He does not believe in the atrocities on Kashmiri Pandits and takes support from Khalistani supporters to form a government in Punjab," Thakur added.

127.title: People asked me if I sniff cocaine in real since Aashram scene: Adhyayan
127.article_body: Actor Adhyayan Suman, speaking about his role in the 'Aashram' series, said it was similar to that of Shahid Kapoor in 'Udta Punjab'. However, he added he didn't want to "ape" Shahid in any way. He further revealed, "People have even asked me whether I sniff cocaine in real life since that scene of mine in the 'Aashram' series became...popular!"

128.title: Pro-Khalistan slogans, Bhindranwale posters raised outside Golden Temple
128.article_body: A group of people gathered at the entrance of the Golden Temple in Punjab's Amritsar and raised pro-Khalistan slogans on the anniversary of Operation Bluestar on Monday. The group also carried  posters of Khalistani separatist Jarnail Bhindranwale. Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann had last week reviewed the law and order situation in the state ahead of the Operation Bluestar anniversary.

129.title: Rapes have come down because PM Modi gave women toilets: Sambit Patra
129.article_body: BJP national spokesperson Sambit Patra said that rapes have come down in many states because Prime Minister Narendra Modi gave toilets to women. He reportedly said that rapes happened when women in rural areas used to go out to attend nature's call in the dark. "Modi is the first Prime Minister in the world who talked about toilets," he added.

130.title: 'Always' actor Brad Johnson dies due to COVID-19 complications
130.article_body: Actor Brad Johnson, known for his role in Steven Spielberg's romantic drama 'Always', has passed away aged 62. His representative Linda McAlister told The Hollywood Reporter that Brad died of complications from COVID-19 on February 18 in Fort Worth, Texas. "He lived life to the fullest and taught his children to do the same," his family said in a statement.

131.title: It is a trouble-engine not double-engine govt in Bihar: Tejashwi
131.article_body: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Sunday criticised CM Nitish Kumar-led NDA government in Bihar, saying, "Some...say it's a double-engine government in Bihar. But it's a trouble-engine government."  In Bihar, inflation is high, farmers are in "distress" and "no one talks about labourers and unemployment", he claimed. RJD is the only regional party that hasn't "compromised" with BJP, he also claimed.

132.title: We respect him a lot, truly unbelievable: Williamson on Root's 10,000 Test runs
132.article_body: New Zealand captain Kane Williamson has praised Joe Root for taking England "over the line" in the first Test at Lord's. "It was a fantastic game, finely balanced...[and] Joe took them over the line. Absolutely (we respect him a lot in New Zealand). Truly unbelievable achievement (10,000 Test runs)," stated Kane. Root smashed his 26th Test hundred in the game.

133.title: Mandy Moore expecting second child with husband Taylor Goldsmith
133.article_body: American singer-actress Mandy Moore took to Instagram to share that she is expecting her second child with husband Taylor Goldsmith. She shared a picture of her son August Harrison Goldsmith wearing a t-shirt with 'big brother' printed on it. "Baby Boy Goldsmith #2 coming this fall...Gus is [going to] be the BEST big brother," Mandy wrote.

134.title: India reports 4,518 COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, active cases rise to 25,782
134.article_body: India has reported 4,518 COVID-19 cases, 2,779 recoveries and 9 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 4,270 COVID-19 cases and 15 deaths. Active cases in India increased to 25,782, while the death toll reached 5,24,701.

135.title: Who is Nupur Sharma, whose remarks made 3 nations call Indian envoys?
135.article_body: Former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma is a graduate in economics from Delhi University's Hindu College and also studied LLB from DU before completing her Master's degree in law from the London School of Economics. In 2008, she won the post of Delhi University Students' Union President. In 2015 Delhi Assembly election, she lost to Arvind Kejriwal from New Delhi constituency.

136.title: Only ICMR-accredited labs to conduct COVID-19 tests: DDMA
136.article_body: The Delhi Disaster Management Authority has directed that only ICMR-accredited labs can collect samples for COVID-19 tests in the national capital. "The personnel being employed by labs should be adequately qualified as per the qualifications fixed by ICMR/NABL or any authorised agency," said DDMA. It also directed the district magistrates to conduct surprise inspections of labs.

137.title: 2 players get retired out in same T20 match for the first time in history
137.article_body: The T20 Blast 2022 match between Birmingham Bears and Nottinghamshire marked the first instance of two players getting retired out in the same T20 match. The match which was reduced to eight-overs-a-side game saw Birmingham Bears' Carlos Brathwaite retiring out for 17(11) ahead of the last over. Meanwhile, Nottinghamshire's Samit Patel was retired out for 2(2).

138.title: French Open final vs Nadal is something I'll tell my grandkids about: Casper Ruud
138.article_body: Casper Ruud, who lost the French Open final against Rafael Nadal, has said he'll remember the match for the rest of his career and tell his grandkids about it. "I wish I could make the match closer...but at the end of the day...I'm going to enjoy this moment for a long time," he added. Nadal defeated Casper 6-3, 6-3, 6-0.

139.title: We've some people in TMC who pass on information to us: WB BJP chief
139.article_body: West Bengal BJP chief Sukanta Majumdar said his party has some people in TMC who pass on information to them. "In fact, every party plants its men in other parties to remain privy to crucial decisions taken by its political opponents," he added. Reacting to his remark, TMC's Kunal Ghosh said, "No one believes what he (Majumdar) says now."

140.title: Noida woman cheated of ₹2.64 lakh by man she met on social media
140.article_body: A Noida woman was allegedly cheated of ₹2.64 lakh by a man, claiming to be German, she befriended on social media. He said he would meet her in Goa. Later, he claimed to have been detained by customs officials for carrying 50,000 pounds in cash meant for her. The woman was then asked to pay for his release.

141.title: I'm doing exactly what other heroines are doing today: Ankita Lokhande
141.article_body: Actress Ankita Lokhande said that she is confident about herself and added that it doesn't matter if she does a big film or not. "I'm doing today exactly what other heroines are doing, I'm looking as well, dressing in the same clothes, I'm a good actor and dancer too," she stated. "I'm...confident about myself, I don't need people," she added.

142.title: Twitter user shares video of men wheeling on B'luru road, police respond
142.article_body:
A Twitter user shared a video of two men on a scooty, wheeling in Bengaluru. "@BlrCityPolice
wheeling between Hosakerehalli and Somapura on NICE road this afternoon. What was also unfortunate was [that] just 5 kms from this place, there was an interceptor catching speeding vehicles and it appears these guys were fully aware," the tweet read.

143.title: Pune's SPPU to get ₹10 crore to build pool, other facilities
143.article_body: The Maharashtra government has allocated ₹10 crore to Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) to build infrastructure and sports facilities, including a swimming pool. The fund will also be used to develop a memorial of the leader, Savitribai Phule. Announcing the decision, Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said that all necessary help to upgrade the sports complex in SPPU will be given.

144.title: Dad got letters saying 'Want to marry you' after mom's death: Nargis' daughter
144.article_body: Late actors Sunil Dutt and Nargis' daughter Priya Dutt said after her mother Nargis passed away, her father got letters from women saying they want to marry him and that they would take care of his children. "Once we told him, 'Dad if you like someone...it's okay...We will understand'...He laughed and said, 'I haven't found...anyone like your mother'," Priya added.

145.title: Govt plans to revamp New Delhi Railway Station on its own: Report
145.article_body: The Centre is reportedly planning to undertake the New Delhi Railway Station's revamp project completely by themselves instead of doing it under the PPP model. A ₹4,700 crore plan is currently undergoing evaluation where the Centre is looking to directly fund the Engineering Procurement and Construction contracts. Notably, a six-floor station complex is planned as part of the redevelopment.

146.title: B'luru reports 1st COVID-19 death in June as new cases rise to 291
146.article_body: Bengaluru recorded 291 new coronavirus cases and one death on Sunday, according to BBMP data. This is the first death reported in June due to the virus. The number of active clusters in the city is currently 12, while the positivity rate is 1.62%, the data showed. The city reported 142 recoveries the same day, the data also showed.

147.title: He wanted Broad to go and have a slog: Stokes on McCullum's strategy vs NZ
147.article_body: After winning the first Test against New Zealand, England Test captain Ben Stokes revealed that head coach Brendon McCullum wanted Stuart Broad to bat if Joe Root or Ben Foakes had lost their wicket during their chase of NZ's 277-run target. "That's the kind of stuff that we're not used to in the dressing room," Stokes added.

148.title: Duo attacks man over suspected affair with one of their ex-girlfriends in Pune
148.article_body: Two men, aged 24 and 25, allegedly attacked a 20-year-old man with sharp weapons on suspicion that the latter was having an affair with one of the duo's former girlfriends in Pune, according to the police. One accused was arrested, while the police are looking for the other. The victim was taken to a hospital and his condition is stable.

149.title: Centre in denial, wants everyone to pretend all is well in J&K: Farooq
149.article_body: Former J&K CM Farooq Abdullah said the central government is living in "denial" and it wants everyone to keep their heads down and pretend all is well in Kashmir, including Kashmiri Pandits. Speaking about the recent incidents of violence in the Valley, Abdullah said, "They (central government) want to project normalcy to the world when it is the exact opposite."

150.title: Hire for real tech skills with Scaler Enterprise: Scaler
150.article_body: EdTech startup, Scaler, launches a hiring portal, Scaler Enterprise, with a campaign highlighting the importance of real tech skills. It aims to aid CTOs, Senior Engineers, and Recruiters in finding problem-solvers who are fit to scale their product, said Scaler. It added that it is key to look beyond hiring biases to build a team with top tech potential.

151.title: Saudi Arabia condemns ex-BJP leader Nupur Sharma's remarks on Prophet Muhammad
151.article_body: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia has said in a statement that it expresses its condemnation of the statements made by the former BJP spokesperson, Nupur Sharma, insulting Prophet Muhammad. Earlier, Qatar, Kuwait and Iran summoned Indian ambassadors to condemn Nupur Sharma's remarks against Prophet Mohammed.

152.title: Ronaldo's mother tears up as he scores goal for Portugal, pics go viral
152.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo's mother teared up after he scored a goal for Portugal against Switzerland in a Nations League match. Pictures of Ronaldo's mother getting emotional in the stands have gone viral. Ronaldo scored two goals in the match as Portugal beat Switzerland 4-0. Ronaldo has now scored 117 goals in international football.

153.title: I was shocked that he didn't run: Riyan Parag on giving 'death stare' to Ashwin
153.article_body: Opening up on giving a 'death stare' to Ravichandran Ashwin after getting run out against GT in IPL 2022 Qualifier 1, Riyan Parag said, "It would've been fine if Ashwin was batting with tail-ender. He should run when I'm batting. I was shocked." He added, "Later, Ashwin came to me and said sorry because he was thinking something...and didn’t run."

154.title: Pune's Rohan Pethe bags 5th rank in UPSC, to join Indian Air Force
154.article_body: Pune resident Rohan Pethe bagged the fifth rank in the Combined Defence Services Examination conducted by the UPSC. He has been selected to join the flying branch of the Indian Air Force. A final year engineering student from Vishwakarma Institute of Technology, Pune, Pethe will be the third-generation officer from his family to join the military.

155.title: ED raids Satyendar Jain's home in alleged money laundering case
155.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) conducted searches at residence of Delhi's Health Minister Satyendar Jain in connection with hawala transactions related to a Kolkata-based company. Jain was arrested in the case on May 30. CBI had earlier alleged that Jain and his family set up four shell firms to launder ₹11.78 crore in 2010-12 and ₹4.63 crore in 2015-16.

156.title: 8 water ATMs in Pune Cantonment area lying defunct since 2019
156.article_body: A total of eight water ATMs installed in eight wards of Pune Cantonment area in 2016-17 are lying defunct since past three years. "Due to lack of timely service and attention by [Pune Cantonment Board (PCB)], these ATMs have become defunct," a resident said. Some components need to be changed otherwise it'll affect water quality, said PCB CEO Subrat Pal.

157.title: Fake intl call centre cheating US citizens busted in Delhi; 4 arrested
157.article_body: A fake international call centre operating in Delhi, which allegedly cheated US citizens on the pretext of providing them with technical support from Microsoft, has been busted and four people have been arrested. Police said the accused cheated their targets by inducing them to pay money for solving a non-existent problem. They sometimes also made their targets buy gift cards.

158.title: Rafael Nadal and French Open, the romance continues: Ojha
158.article_body: Taking to Twitter following world number five Rafael Nadal's record-extending 14th French Open win on Sunday, ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha wrote, "Nadal and French Open, the romance continues." Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag tweeted, "King of clay. What a Champion. Nadal. Number 14 at Roland Garros." Roger Federer's coach Ivan Ljubicic said, "There is no word to describe this feat."

159.title: Winning 14th French Open title is amazing, means everything: Nadal
159.article_body: Talking about his record-extending 14th French Open title, 36-year-old Rafael Nadal said it's "amazing" and means everything. "Much more probably emotional than the first time because [it's] completely unexpected to be where I am at this age, at this stage of my career." It's Nadal's 22nd Grand Slam title. At 19, he won the 2005 French Open on his debut.

160.title: Russian plane's detention in Sri Lanka is private legal issue: PM
160.article_body: Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe has informed Russia that the detention of an Aeroflot aircraft in Colombo is a private legal matter. The Russian flag carrier has suspended flights to Sri Lanka in response. Reportedly, a company owning the plane claimed that Aeroflot had continued to fly the aircraft despite the lease agreement between them being terminated in March.

161.title: A modern day Hercules: Shastri to Nadal on his 14th French Open win
161.article_body: Reacting to Rafael Nadal's record-extending 14th French Open title, Ravi Shastri tweeted, "A modern day Hercules who just will not melt in...hottest claypot. Starts favourite to make it 15 only. Just insane. Salute forever." Nadal's 6-3, 6-3, 6-0 win over eighth-seeded Casper Ruud gave him a record-extending 22nd Grand Slam title. Nadal is now 112-3 win-loss lifetime at Roland Garros.

162.title: Salman's father found threat letter on bench where he sits daily: Police
162.article_body: The threat letter sent to actor Salman Khan and his father Salim Khan was found by the latter on a bench where he sits daily after jogging, police said. Salim Khan found the letter at 7.30-8.00 am on Sunday morning near Bandra Bandstand Promenade in Mumbai, police added. An FIR against an unknown person has been filed.

163.title: Ankita, Vicky crowned winners of Smart Jodi, win ₹25-lakh cash prize
163.article_body: Smart Jodi contestants Ankita Lokhande and Vicky Jain were announced as the winners of the show on Sunday. They took home a 'golden gathbandhan' frame and a ₹25 lakh cash prize. Comedian Balraj and his wife, singer Deepti, were announced as the first runners-up. The Star Plus show which lasted eight weeks, was hosted by Maniesh Paul.

164.title: After Qatar & Kuwait, Iran summons Indian envoy over BJP leader's remark against Prophet
164.article_body: After Qatar and Kuwait, Iran has also summoned the Indian ambassador to condemn and reject a BJP leader's remarks against Prophet Mohammed. The state media called it an "insult against Prophet of Islam in an Indian TV show". This comes ahead of Iranian Foreign Minister's first-ever trip to India next week.

165.title: Joe Root becomes joint-youngest batter to reach 10,000 Test runs, breaks Sachin's record
165.article_body: Former England captain Joe Root has become the joint-youngest batter to reach 10,000 runs in Test cricket. Root completed 10,000 runs in Test cricket at the age of 31 years and 157 days, equalling Alastair Cook's record. He overtook Sachin Tendulkar, who had reached the 10,000-run mark at the age of 31 years and 326 days.

166.title: Look into this: FM to LIC as 17-yr-old orphan gets notices to repay ₹29 lakh loan
166.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has asked LIC to look into the matter of a 17-year-old orphan girl receiving legal notices from the state-run insurer to repay ₹29 lakh on a home loan taken by her father. Vanisha lost both her parents to COVID-19 during the second wave. LIC has blocked her father's savings as Vanisha is a minor, TOI reported.

167.title: Spain to deliver anti-aircraft missiles & tanks to Ukraine: Report
167.article_body: Spain will supply anti-aircraft missiles and tanks to Ukraine as it seeks to boost its military support to the country, according to government sources cited by a local newspaper. Spain will also provide essential training to Ukraine's military in how to use the tanks, it claimed. Spain has supplied ammunition, individual protection equipment and light weapons to Ukraine so far.

168.title: VP Naidu launches India-Qatar Start-Up bridge in Doha
168.article_body: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on Sunday launched the "India-Qatar Start-Up bridge" at the India-Qatar Business Forum in Doha to link the startup ecosystems of the two countries. "We have now a very robust India-Qatar economic partnership and it's getting enriched with each passing day," Naidu said. Number of Indian businesses in Qatar has also increased, he added.

169.title: Swiatek's reaction after seeing Robert Lewandowski in French Open final crowd goes viral
169.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek's reaction after seeing footballer Robert Lewandowski in the French Open women's singles final crowd has gone viral. The eventual winner Swiatek was visibly surprised to see Lewandowski. "He has been a top athlete in our country for so many years...it's hard to believe that he came to watch me. Just overawed," Swiatek said.

170.title: 4 injured as clash erupts between 2 groups in Gujarat's Surendranagar
170.article_body: At least four persons were injured in a clash between two upper-class groups in Gujarat's Surendranagar on Sunday, police said. According to a villager, the clash broke out over a dispute on passing through a road between two-three fields. As per reports, one of the groups also attacked a house nearby and broke vehicles parked there.

171.title: Huge inspiration for sporting world: ABD on Nadal's record 14th French Open
171.article_body: After Rafael Nadal beat eighth-seeded Casper Ruud to win a record-extending 14th French Open, AB de Villiers said the Spaniard is a "huge inspiration for the sporting world!" He added, "I hope all youngsters were watching, especially...pre and post match respect between opponents and to the sport." The 36-year-old has also claimed a men's all-time record 22nd Grand Slam title.

172.title: Thai Police rescue 59 Rohingya refugees from island near Malaysia
172.article_body: The police in Thailand on Sunday said that they had rescued 59 Rohingya refugees who had been abandoned by people smugglers from a Thai island near Malaysia. "The boat driver told them they had arrived in Malaysia and left them on the island a few days ago," they added. The refugees include 23 women and five children.

173.title: Police insert stick in UP man's rectum, give electric shocks; pay him ₹100 later
173.article_body: Five policemen have been booked in Uttar Pradesh's Budaun for allegedly torturing a man they arrested in connection with cattle slaughter case. The victim's mother said the policemen shoved a stick inside the man's rectum and gave him repeated electric shocks. She added that policemen paid him ₹100 before releasing him after they realised they arrested the wrong person.

174.title: BJP becoming 'Cong-yukt': AAP after 4 ex-Punjab Cong ministers join BJP
174.article_body: AAP on Sunday said BJP which used to talk about a "Congress-mukt Bharat (Congress-free India)" is itself becoming "Congress-yukt (filled with Congress)". This comes a day after four former Punjab Congress ministers joined BJP. AAP leader Malvinder Singh Kang also accused BJP of double standards, stating that it welcomed many Congress leaders against whom it had levelled several charges earlier.
