175.title: Ranveer, Salman & Aamir attend Ambani event hosted for Anant's fiancee Radhika
175.article_body: Actors Ranveer Singh, Salman Khan and Aamir Khan were seen at an Arangetram event hosted by Nita and Mukesh Ambani for their son Anant Ambani's fiancee Radhika Merchant on Sunday. The event is traditionally hosted for the debut dance performance of a trained Bharatanatyam dancer. Ambanis hosted the event at Jio World Centre in Mumbai.

176.title: 'Mr Dependable' Root, what a player: Stokes on England's 1st Test win vs NZ
176.article_body: Following England's five-wicket win against New Zealand in first Test, England captain Ben Stokes said no one had the upper hand and the way his side handled pressure in fourth innings on a "difficult" wicket at Lord's was fantastic. "And obviously 'Mr dependable', Joe Root, stood up. Scoring a hundred and 10,000 runs- what a player...what a man," he added.

177.title: Delhi's maximum temperature reaches 47°C for 2nd straight day
177.article_body: The maximum temperature reached 47°C in Delhi's Mungeshpur for the second consecutive day on Sunday amid a heatwave in the national capital, the India Meteorological Department said. Jafarpur, Najafgarh, Ridge and Pitampura observatories recorded over 45°C. On Saturday, the highest maximum temperature in Delhi was recorded at Mungeshpur at 47.1°C.

178.title: Fringe elements' view, not our govt's: India to Kuwait over BJP leader's remark on Prophet
178.article_body: After Kuwait condemned BJP leader's remarks on Prophet Mohammed and sought India's apology, Indian embassy in Kuwait released a statement, saying that the offensive tweets were fringe elements' view. "The tweets do not, in any manner, reflect the views of the Government of India...Strong action has been taken," India stated. BJP suspended Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal over remarks.

179.title: Unseeded Garcia-Mladenovic win their 2nd French Open title as a team
179.article_body: Unseeded French pair of Caroline Garcia and Kristina Mladenovic have clinched their second French Open women's doubles title together. The 2016 champions defeated eighth seeds Coco Gauff and Jessica Pegula of America 2-6, 6-3, 6-2 in final on Sunday. Overall, this is Mladenovic's fourth French Open women's doubles title, having won it in 2019 and 2020 alongside Hungary's Timea Babos.

180.title: Indian Railways cancelled nearly 9,000 train services this year
180.article_body: The Indian Railways cancelled nearly 9,000 train services this year, according to an RTI reply. Of these, more than 1,900 train services were cancelled from March to May for the movement of coal, the Railways said. The Railways also said that it had cancelled 6,995 train services for maintenance work or for construction purposes.

181.title: Gunmen kill 50 in attack on church in Nigeria: Lawmaker
181.article_body: At least 50 people have been killed in an attack by gunmen on a Catholic church in Nigeria's Ondo state during mass on Sunday, a lawmaker said. Local media said the gunmen had fired at worshippers and detonated explosives at the church. "I am deeply saddened by the unprovoked attack and killing of innocent people," the Governor of Ondo tweeted.

182.title: Our planet is one, but efforts have to be many: PM at 'LiFE Movement' launch
182.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday launched the 'Lifestyle for the Environment (LiFE) Movement' and said, "Our planet is one, but our efforts have to be many." "Mahatma Gandhi talked about a zero-carbon lifestyle. In our daily life choices, let us pick the most sustainable options," he added. "Let us follow the principle of reuse, reduce and recycle," the PM said.

183.title: Want to keep batting as long as I can: Root after 26th Test century
183.article_body: England batter Joe Root said he wants to bat as long as he can and win as many matches possible for his side following the hosts' five-wicket win against New Zealand in first Test at Lord's. "As long as I've got the energy...drive to do it, I'll do it," he added. Root (115*) hit his 26th century in the match.

184.title: Lebanon warns Israel against any aggression in disputed waters
184.article_body: Lebanon on Sunday warned Israel against any "aggressive action" in disputed waters where both countries hope to develop offshore energy. This comes after a storage and production ship arrived in the waters to produce gas for Israel on Sunday. Israel has claimed that the field in question is not in disputed waters but within its Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ).

185.title: PM Modi announces ₹2-lakh aid for 22 MP pilgrims killed in bus accident in U'khand
185.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed his grief at the death of 22 pilgrims after their bus fell into a gorge in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district on Sunday. PM Modi announced ₹2-lakh aid for the relatives of those killed and ₹50,000 for the injured persons. The bus was carrying 28 pilgrims from Madhya Pradesh's Panna district.

186.title: After Qatar, Kuwait seeks India's apology over BJP leader's remarks on Prophet
186.article_body: After Qatar, Kuwait on Sunday summoned Indian ambassador and handed him an official protest note expressing Kuwait's condemnation of the "insulting statements" against Prophet Mohammed "by one of the officials in India's ruling party". While welcoming the BJP leader's suspension, Kuwait said, "It demands a public apology for those hostile statements." BJP suspended Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal.

187.title: Role in 'Chennai Express' wasn't great, did it for SRK: Sathyaraj
187.article_body: Actor Sathyaraj has spoken about his role in 2013 film 'Chennai Express' which featured Shah Rukh Khan, saying he felt it was "not that great a role" for him. The actor added that he conveyed it to director Rohit Shetty and also to Shah Rukh. "But I eventually did the film because I like Shah Rukh very much," Sathyaraj said.

188.title: Nadal becomes oldest French Open men's singles champ, clinches his 22nd Grand Slam title
188.article_body: Ex-world number one Rafael Nadal defeated world number eight Casper Ruud 6-3, 6-3, 6-0 in the Roland Garros 2022 final to win the French Open for a record-extending 14th time. With this, Nadal became the oldest player to win French Open men's singles title aged 36. The Spaniard has now won a record-extending 22 Grand Slam titles.

189.title: I see lots of curated negativity: Kangana on 'Dhaakad' performance
189.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut shared the screenshot of an article calling her "Box office queen of India" on Instagram Stories. She wrote alongside it, "2019 I gave 'Manikarnika'...super hit...2021 I gave...'Thalaivii' which came on OTT and was huge success." She further wrote, "I see lots of curated negativity but 2022 is the year of blockbuster 'Lock Upp'...And it's not over yet."

190.title: I was told not to do horror films so early in my career: Mugdha Godse
190.article_body: Actress-model Mugdha Veira Godse said things have changed in the industry from the time when she started. "When I had just joined, it was like if you have started with...film like 'Fashion' then you need to take up 'A' list films only," she added. "I was told ‘Why are you doing horror films so early in your career?'" Mugdha said.

191.title: France in talks with UAE to replace Russian oil supplies: Finance Min
191.article_body: France is in talks with the United Arab Emirates (UAE) to replace Russian oil purchases, French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said on Sunday. "We have to find an alternative to Russian oil," he added. Notably, this comes after the European Union (EU) announced its decision to ban 90% of Russian crude oil imports by the end of the year.

192.title: 15 pilgrims dead after bus from MP falls into gorge in Uttarakhand
192.article_body: At least 15 people died and several others were injured after a bus carrying 28 pilgrims from Madhya Pradesh's Panna district fell into a gorge in Uttarkashi district of Uttarakhand on Sunday. Fifteen bodies have been recovered, Director General of Police Ashok Kumar said. The accident took place in the Damta area of Uttarkashi.

193.title: Chinese firms under govt probe for tax evasion collected Indians' data: Report
193.article_body: Chinese companies being probed for tax evasion in India were gathering personal data of Indians for senior Chinese Communist Party (CCP) members, according to a report by Economic Times. Many Chinese firms are directly or indirectly owned by senior CCP members, the report said. Several Chinese loan apps promised easy money and burdened users with hefty interest, the report added.

194.title: Overwhelmed at 'Shershaah' winning 6 IIFA awards: Karan Johar
194.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar celebrated Sidharth Malhotra and Kiara Advani-starrer 'Shershaah' winning the highest number of awards at the 2022 IIFA awards with six victories. The filmmaker shared a list of the film's wins on social media, writing, "A major win at the #IIFA2022...Overwhelmed and PROUD to have painted this story for the world to watch & shower their unending love."

195.title: Qatar's investment in India has grown 5 times since March 2020: VP Naidu
195.article_body: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on Sunday met Qatar's PM and Interior Minister Sheikh Khalid bin Khalifa bin Abdulaziz Al Thani in Doha. He said, "Qatar's investment in India has grown five times since March 2020." Naidu added that it is still well below potential and can be substantially increased.

196.title: Aishwarya joins Abhishek in an impromptu dance at IIFA 2022, video goes viral
196.article_body: Actress Aishwarya Rai Bachchan joined her husband, actor Abhishek Bachchan in an impromptu dance at the 22nd IIFA awards held in Abu Dhabi. In the video that surfaced online, the actor came down from the stage and was seen dancing with his family, Aishwarya and his daughter Aaradhya Bachchan. He is seen wearing a white sherwani in the video.

197.title: 7 girls drown while taking bath in check dam in Tamil Nadu
197.article_body: Seven girls, aged between 10 and 18, drowned at a check dam built across river Gadilam near Tamil Nadu's Cuddalore on Sunday. According to police, the incident took place when the group entered the water to take a bath and were washed away by a strong undercurrent in the deep end of the dam. CM MK Stalin has expressed grief.

198.title: Siraj called me, said 'You are a kid, behave like a kid': Parag on fight with Harshal
198.article_body: Referring to his fight with RCB's Harshal Patel in IPL 2022, RR's Riyan Parag said he made a hand gesture towards Harshal after hitting him for a six but didn't say anything. Parag added Harshal had made a similar gesture towards him in IPL 2021. Parag stated that Mohammed Siraj called him and said, "You're a kid...behave like a kid."

199.title: All time great: Ganguly on Root after his 10,000 runs in Test cricket
199.article_body: Reacting to England batter Joe Root completing 10,000 runs in Tests following his 115*(170) against New Zealand in first Test, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly took to Twitter and wrote, "Roooooooot...what a player what a knock under pressure...an all time great." Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "Root has 10,000 Test runs. And he's just 31. Well played...congratulations." England won by five wickets.

200.title: Pakistan's PM seeks emergency plan to end load-shedding
200.article_body: Pakistan's PM Shehbaz Sharif on Saturday directed authorities to prepare an emergency plan to reduce load-shedding in the country. The load-shedding in various parts of the country has been creating problems for citizens, according to a report. Sharif has tasked a committee comprising of ministers for energy, petroleum and finance to present an actionable plan.

201.title: Salman Khan receives threat letter, FIR filed
201.article_body: Actor Salman Khan and his father Salim Khan received a threat letter on Sunday, Mumbai Police have said. An FIR has also been filed against an unknown person by Bandra Police and a further probe is underway, they added. Security was earlier increased around Salman's apartment after gangster Lawrence Bishnoi emerged as the prime suspect in Sidhu Moosewala's murder.

202.title: India responds after Qatar seeks govt's apology over BJP leader's remarks on Prophet
202.article_body: Indian Embassy has released a statement after Qatar summoned Indian ambassador and sought government's apology over BJP leader's remarks on Prophet Mohammed. "Ambassador conveyed that the [offensive] tweets don't...reflect the views of Government of India...Strong action has already been taken against those who made the derogatory remarks," it said. BJP suspended Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal.

203.title: No other species can send life to Mars, humanity can't let them down: Musk
203.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk on Sunday tweeted, "Humanity is life's steward, as no other species can transport life to Mars." The SpaceX CEO said that humanity can't let down the other species. He also revealed that his plan is to build over 1,000 Starship rockets to transport life to Mars. "Basically, (very) modern Noah's Arks," Musk added.

204.title: Tanks supplied by the West to Ukraine destroyed in airstrikes: Russia
204.article_body: Russia on Sunday said that it had destroyed tanks and armoured vehicles supplied to Ukraine by some eastern European countries during airstrikes on Kyiv, the first such strikes on the capital in weeks. The tanks and armoured vehicles were part of the military aid from the West. Notably, President Vladimir Putin has warned the West against supplying weapons to Ukraine.

205.title: Get well Shah Rukh: Mamata as reports say SRK tested COVID-19 positive
205.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee reacted to reports of the state's brand ambassador, actor Shah Rukh Khan, testing positive for COVID-19 and said, "(I) pray for the fastest recovery for the superstar." She added, "Get well Shahrukh! Spring back asap!" Actor Kartik Aaryan has tested positive for COVID-19 while reports said that actor Aditya Roy Kapur also tested positive.

206.title: We expect public apology from Indian govt: Qatar on BJP leader's remarks on Prophet
206.article_body: Qatar summoned Indian ambassador Deepak Mittal and handed him a note expressing disappointment, rejection and condemnation "to the controversial remarks made by an official in the ruling party in India against Prophet Mohammed". Welcoming BJP's decision to suspend the official, Qatar said it's "expecting a public apology and immediate condemnation of these remarks" from Indian government.

207.title: Jared Leto's 'Morbius' re-released in over 1,000 US theatres
207.article_body: Jared Leto-starrer 'Morbius' was re-released in over 1,000 theatres across the US after memes about the film's catchphrase "It's Morbin' Time!" went viral on social media. The film was first released on April 1 and had performed poorly at the box office. As per reports, the film only earned a total of $85,000 (almost ₹66 lakh) upon re-release on Friday.

208.title: Shocked & appalled by the insensitivity: Hrithik Roshan on Layer'r Shot's ads
208.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan reacted to the ads for body spray Layer'r Shot which have been accused of promoting rape culture and gang rape. Taking to Instagram, he wrote, "Shocked and appalled by the insensitivity of this commercial. How could the entire team associated with this project think this was ok to make and showcase? Kudos to...viewers for calling it out."

209.title: Youth arrested for lacing teenager's cold drink, raping her in Pune
209.article_body: Police in Pune have arrested a youth for allegedly raping a teenager whom he had befriended on social media. The youth had allegedly laced the survivor's cold drink with a sedative before committing the crime. The accused had also allegedly threatened to upload a video of the act online if she informed her parents and kept sexually abusing her.

210.title: Heatwave conditions in Gurugram to continue till June 9: IMD
210.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has said that Gurugram and its adjoining areas will experience heatwave conditions till June 9. "People should take adequate precautions. Avoid going out during peak hours in the afternoon and stay hydrated," an IMD official said. The city on Saturday recorded a maximum temperature of 45.3 degrees Celsius.

211.title: Pune Police cracks at least 10 cases of thefts of MUV silencers
211.article_body: Pune Police has cracked at least 10 cases of thefts of silencers of multi-utility vehicles (MUV) for the extraction of valuable metallic dust from the catalytic converter of these units. A police team was probing multiple cases of such thefts. Police said the mixed dust of three metals is sold at ₹3,000 per gram in the illegal market.

212.title: England's most complete all-round batter of all time: Vaughan to Root
212.article_body: Praising Joe Root after he reached the 10,000-run mark in Tests, Michael Vaughan tweeted, "England's most complete all-round batter of all time...10,000 runs and to do it with a match winning 100 is incredible...Well done." Root achieved this landmark in England's five-wicket win against New Zealand in the first Test at Lord's. He scored 115*(170) in England's second innings.

213.title: Delhi court extends Lawrence Bishnoi's police custody for 5 days
213.article_body: A Delhi court on Sunday extended the police custody of gangster Lawrence Bishnoi in connection with the Arms Act case for five more days. He earlier withdrew his plea from the High Court seeking necessary security saying he apprehended a fake encounter by Punjab Police. The Delhi Police didn't mention singer Sidhu Moosewala's murder probe against Bishnoi.

214.title: Mumbai reports 961 new COVID-19 cases, 1 death; positivity rate at 10.94%
214.article_body: Mumbai has reported 961 fresh COVID-19 cases, 374 recoveries and one death in the last 24 hours. The city reported a positivity rate of 10.94%, while the number of active COVID-19 cases now stands at 4,880. The overall growth rate of COVID-19 cases in the city between May 29 and June 4 was 0.057%.

215.title: 1st arrest made in Hapur factory explosion that claimed 13 lives
215.article_body: One of the main accused in the explosion at a factory in Uttar Pradesh's Hapur was arrested on Sunday. The accused, Wasim, had taken the factory on rent from its owner Dilshad Khan, police said, adding that raids are being conducted to arrest Khan. At least 13 people were killed and 21 others were injured in the incident on Saturday.

216.title: I withdraw my statement: Nupur as BJP suspends her for remarks on Prophet Muhammad
216.article_body: Nupur Sharma retracted her remarks on Prophet Muhammad, made during a TV debate on the Gyanvapi issue, after being suspended by the BJP on Sunday. "I have been attending TV debates for the past many days where our Mahadev was being insulted and disrespected continuously...I couldn't tolerate this continuous insult...and said some things in response to it," said Sharma.

217.title: Ammy Virk's 'Sher Bagga' postponed after Sidhu Moosewala's demise
217.article_body: Punjabi actor-singer Ammy Virk has announced that the release of his upcoming film 'Sher Bagga' has been postponed after singer Sidhu Moosewala's death. He shared a note on Instagram Stories, writing, "Due to extremely sad and unfortunate time, we are not in a state of mind to celebrate this art form." Sidhu was shot dead in Punjab on May 29.

218.title: Aus could go in with just one pacer in Tests vs Sri Lanka: Hazlewood
218.article_body: Australia pacer Josh Hazlewood said his side could go into two-Test series against Sri Lanka with just one specialist pacer, given spin-friendly pitch in Galle. "We obviously know...three of us (Pat Cummins, Mitchell Starc and himself) are going to play in most conditions...it's probably me who's a bit slower on airspeed who drops out on spinning wickets," he added.

219.title: IL&FS creditors to get ₹16,000 crore on pro-rata basis
219.article_body: National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) has approved the interim distribution of ₹16,361 crore to IL&FS creditors at the holding company level. The amount includes ₹11,296 crore in cash and ₹5,065 crore in Infrastructure Investment Trusts. The interim distribution "shall be implemented only after approval by the new board" and "shall take place [on] pro rata basis", NCLAT said.

220.title: 2 lower primary school students infected with norovirus in Kerala
220.article_body: Two lower primary school students in Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram were found infected with norovirus, which is similar to diarrhoea-inducing rotavirus. It is suspected that the students got food poisoning from midday meals distributed at their school. At least 13 people at a veterinary college in Wayanad were infected with the virus in November last year.

221.title: They passed away without any suffering: AR Rahman on KK's demise
221.article_body: During an appearance at the IIFA awards, music composer AR Rahman spoke about the demise of singer KK. He said, "[It's] shocking! Actually, somebody going after a concert feels very shocking." "At the very same time, I also feel like it is so blessed. They were doing something they love and they passed away without any suffering," he added.

222.title: Gagging, is giving them publicity worse? Sona on Layer'r Shot ads
222.article_body: Singer Sona Mohapatra reacted to Layer'r Shot ads accused of promoting rape mentality, tweeting, "Gagging after I saw it here on my Twitter timeline & wondering if giving them additional publicity is worse." She further wrote, "The makers of the ad as well as the brand [need] to pay a hefty sum to a worthy cause; held accountable even commercially."

223.title: Actress Amy Jackson shares pic with rumoured boyfriend Ed Westwick
223.article_body: Actress Amy Jackson shared a picture with her rumoured boyfriend and Gossip Girl actor Ed Westwick on Instagram. In the picture, she's seen wearing a black top and posing with her arms around Ed. Last month, the paparazzi spotted Amy and Ed holding hands as they walked on a London street. Both of them were twinning in grey casuals.

224.title: 5 of family found hanging at their home in Bihar, forensic team called
224.article_body: Five members of a family, including two children aged eight and 10, were found hanging at their residence in Bihar's Samastipur on Sunday, police said, adding that the family was in debt. A relative of the deceased persons has alleged that her family members were murdered by money lenders. A Forensic Science Laboratory team has been called for an investigation.

225.title: Google disables RCS feature in India after businesses spam users with ads
225.article_body: Google is disabling Rich Communication Services (RCS) feature in India after reports emerged that users are being spammed with unwanted ads by businesses. "We are aware that some businesses are abusing our anti-spam policies to send promotional messages to users in India," Google said. RCS allows verified businesses to send messages, which include images and interactive features, to customers.

226.title: I'm not comfortable doing extremely bold scenes: Erica Fernandes
226.article_body: Actress Erica Fernandes said she isn't comfortable doing extremely bold scenes. "Some people are comfortable doing such scenes. But I am not. It matters to me to do things that I am comfortable with," she added. "Every second project that's coming my way or being made is mainly focused on the intimate part more than the story itself," she said.

227.title: 2 women, 4 minors beat disabled man to death in Mumbai
227.article_body: The police on Friday arrested two women and detained four minors on charges of killing a 51-year-old disabled man in Mumbai's Chembur. All six are accused of assaulting Prakash Waghmare with bamboo sticks on Thursday over his objection to his niece's relationship with one of the minors, according to the police. Waghmare had passed away at a hospital on Friday.

228.title: 400-year-old monastery destroyed in Russian attack, says Ukraine; releases video
228.article_body: A monastery that is around 400 years old has been destroyed in a Russian attack, Ukraine has said while releasing a video of the ancient building on fire. The 17th-century Svyatohirsk Lavra monastery is located near Russian positions in the eastern Donetsk region. It was first destroyed during the Soviet era and rebuilt later.

229.title: There's threat to my family: Nupur as her address is made public in BJP suspension letter
229.article_body: After being suspended from BJP amid controversy over her remarks on Prophet Muhammad, Nupur Sharma tweeted, "I request all media houses and everybody else not to make my address public. There is a security threat to my family." This comes after her suspension letter, which consisted of her address, was shared by various media houses and journalists.

230.title: When Arshdeep bowls at death, he keeps Dhoni and Hardik quiet: Irfan
230.article_body: Irfan Pathan has said pacer Arshdeep Singh was selected in India's 18-member squad for upcoming T20I series against South Africa due to his ability to keep the best batters "quiet". He added, "When he bowls at the death, he keeps MS Dhoni, Hardik Pandya quiet, bowls consistent yorkers against...set batters." Irfan further said that Arshdeep should play all five T20Is.

231.title: List of country-wise monkeypox cases released by WHO
231.article_body: The WHO has released the number of monkeypox cases reported in 27 non-endemic countries between May 13 and June 2. With total cases in these countries rising to 780, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland have the highest number of cases at 207. This is followed by Spain (156), Portugal (138), Canada (58), Germany (57) and France (33).

232.title: What did you do about Delhi's law & order in last 10 days: Atishi asks L-G
232.article_body: AAP MLA Atishi has accused Delhi Lieutenant Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena of "interfering" in the Delhi government's work and "conspiring" to derail democracy. "Today I want to ask him 'What have you done to improve the law and order situation in Delhi in the last 10 days?'," Atishi added. "L-G is acting like a dummy of the...central government," she said.

233.title: There is peace in my life: Vicky Kaushal post marriage with Katrina
233.article_body: During his appearance at the IIFA awards, actor Vicky Kaushal said his married life with his wife, actress Katrina Kaif is going good. Speaking about his life post marriage, Vicky said, "Sukoon bhari hai (there is a lot of peace) in his life." He further added that he's missing Katrina at the award show.

234.title: We'll hit new targets: Putin in warning to West on missile supply to Ukraine
234.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has warned of striking "those targets which we haven't yet been hitting" if the West supplies Ukraine with longer-range missiles, amid the war. This came after the US announced plans to give Ukraine precision HIMARS rocket systems. Putin said the "fuss" around weapon supplies from the West to Ukraine was 'designed to drag the conflict out'.

235.title: Conduct survey of Karnataka's Srirangapatna mosque in 25 days: VHP
235.article_body: Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) has asked authorities in Karnataka's Mandya to conduct a survey at the Jamia mosque in Srirangapatna in 25 days to find out whether it had been a temple. This comes after members of various Hindutva outfits tried to enter the mosque but were stopped by police. VHP said it wanted to pray at the mosque.

236.title: WHO lists 5 key actions to prevent monkeypox
236.article_body: Amid rising monkeypox cases, WHO listed five key actions to prevent the disease. It suggested raising awareness about monkeypox and equipping countries to be able to recognise it. The second step is stopping human-to-human transmission using public health tools. Third step is protecting frontline workers. The next actions are utilising countermeasures like antivirals and accelerating research.

237.title: Delhi witnessed 2,300 accidents in first 5 months of 2022
237.article_body: Delhi saw 2,300 accidents which led to 505 deaths in the first five months of 2022, official data showed. Of these, 495 were fatal accidents and 1,762 were simple accidents. Outer north district, at 56, recorded the highest district-wise deaths, followed by northwest (50) and southwest (46) districts. Shahdara (16) reported least number of deaths, followed by central district (19).

238.title: Lata Mangeshkar never presented herself as a great singer: Arijit
238.article_body: Singer Arijit Singh, remembering late veteran singer Lata Mangeshkar, said, "She never presented herself as...great singer, she always sang like a commoner." "She used to sing complex songs with such ease that it's amazing," Arijit said, adding, "When you listen to...song it seems like it's such an easy song but when you try singing it...you realise how difficult it is."

239.title: Root smashes 26th ton, completes 10,000 Test runs as Eng beat NZ by 5 wickets
239.article_body: England's Joe Root smashed his 26th hundred and reached 10,000 runs in Test cricket as England defeated New Zealand by five wickets in the first Test at Lord's. Root has now become the 14th player in cricket history and second from England to complete 10,000 Test runs. Root remained unbeaten at 115(170) as England chased down New Zealand's 277-run target.

240.title: BMC launches doorstep drive to speed up vaccination rate in Mumbai
240.article_body: The BMC has launched a drive to speed up the COVID-19 vaccination rate in the 12-17 age group and to increase booster dose intake among senior citizens in Mumbai. The drive is a part of the national 'Har Ghar Dastak 2.0' campaign. Only 28% of those in the 12-14 age group have taken the first dose, according to BMC data.

241.title: Congress appoints observers for 3 states ahead of Rajya Sabha polls
241.article_body: Congress on Sunday appointed senior leaders Mallikarjun Kharge, Pawan Kumar Bansal, TS Singh Deo, Bhupesh Baghel and Rajeev Shukla as its central observers ahead of the Rajya Sabha polls.  Kharge has been appointed observer in Maharashtra, Bansal and Deo in Rajasthan and Baghel and Shukla in Haryana. These leaders will take the responsibility with immediate effect.

242.title: Rapper 50 Cent reshares Madonna's pics, compares her to aliens
242.article_body: Rapper 50 Cent reshared a picture shared by singer Madonna on social media along with a series of pictures of aliens. He wrote, "I hope she didn't make her kids take this picture. LOL at 63 somebody tell her to chill out please." In December, he had called her racy photos "the funniest sh*t" and later apologised for his comments.

243.title: Terence shares video of him dancing to KK's 'Such Keh...', says 'Gone too soon'
243.article_body: Choreographer Terence Lewis took to Instagram to pay tribute to KK, who passed away on May 31. He shared a video of himself dancing to Rehnaa Hai Terre Dil Mein's song 'Such Keh Raha Hai', which was sung by the late singer. "Gone Too Soon. KK you will live with us forever," Terence wrote with a broken heart emoji.

244.title: Maharashtra might be seeing 4th wave of COVID-19: Aaditya Thackeray
244.article_body: Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray on Sunday said the state could be seeing the beginning of the fourth COVID-19 wave and urged citizens not to panic. "We're asking everyone to wear masks when stepping outdoors. We haven't made...masks mandatory, but will make it soon," he added. Aaditya appealed to the public to receive the booster dose of the vaccine on time.

245.title: I give a lot more money to climate change than Musk or anyone else: Gates
245.article_body: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates in an interview said that he gives "a lot more money" to climate change than the world's richest person Elon Musk "or anyone else". Musk recently claimed that Gates has a "multi-billion dollar short position" against Tesla. Reacting to the claim, Gates said, "Somebody shorting...(Tesla) stock doesn't slow him down or hurt him in any way."

246.title: BJP suspends Nupur Sharma after her remarks on Prophet Muhammad
246.article_body: BJP has suspended its national spokesperson Nupur Sharma from the party after her controversial remarks on Prophet Muhammad during a TV debate. The party has also suspended Delhi BJP's media in-charge Naveen Kumar Jindal. Notably, violence broke out in Kanpur in Uttar Pradesh on Friday after a Muslim organisation gave a call to shut shops over remarks made by Sharma.

247.title: 150 cr vaali smile sochni padegi: Kartik as 'Bhool...' earns ₹149 cr
247.article_body: Kartik Aaryan on Sunday retweeted film trade analyst Taran Adarsh's post about the box office figures of 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. As per Adarsh, the horror-comedy film has earned ₹149.11 crore in India so far. Kartik wrote, "Kal 150 crore vaali smile sochni padegi." He had earlier shared a picture of himself smiling after 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' crossed the ₹100-crore mark.

248.title: It probably looked like I was freaking out: Gauff on French Open final loss
248.article_body: Following her loss in the first Grand Slam final of her career at French Open, 18-year-old Coco Gauff said, "It probably looked like I was freaking out." She added, "But really, it was just [that] Iga Swiatek was too good." World number one Swiatek defeated 18th seed 6-1, 6-3 in one hour eight minutes on Saturday.

249.title: Bezos' Blue Origin flies 6 tourists to space in 5th crewed mission
249.article_body: Billionaire Jeff Bezos' space tourism venture Blue Origin completed its fifth crewed launch on Saturday after it flew six tourists into space for a 10-minute ride. The crew included Katya Echazarreta, the youngest American woman in space, and Victor Correa Hespanha, the second Brazilian to go into space, among others. The flight touched an altitude of approximately 106 kilometres.

250.title: First batch of 145 Haj pilgrims from J&K leaves for Saudi Arabia
250.article_body: The first batch of 145 Kashmiri pilgrims left for Saudi Arabia to perform the annual Haj pilgrimage, officials said on Sunday. The annual Haj pilgrimage resumed this year after being suspended for two years in view of the COVID-19 pandemic. Around 6,000 pilgrims from the Union Territory are scheduled to undertake the pilgrimage this year, according to the officials.

251.title: BBMP Chief Commissioner plants sapling on World Environment Day
251.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath on Sunday shared pictures of him planting a sapling during World Environment Day celebrations. One of the pictures shows Nath watering the sapling. He said that during the celebrations, which were held at the Independence Park in the city, saplings were also distributed to the public.

252.title: Late singer KK's song 'Dhoop Paani Bahne De' to release on June 6
252.article_body: Director Srijit Mukerji announced that late singer KK's song 'Dhoop Paani Bahne De' from upcoming film 'Sherdil' will release on June 6. Srijit wrote on Twitter, "Had already shared a video of Gulzar Saab and KK from this recording. Never imagined in my wildest dreams the first song of Sherdil will be released in his absence. Travel well, my friend."

253.title: Ukraine plans to restart domestic football leagues from August
253.article_body: Ukraine's football federation president Andriy Pavelko has revealed that they are planning to resume domestic football leagues in the country from August. "I spoke with our president, Volodymyr Zelenskyy, about how important football is to distract...At all levels we will start in August," stated Pavelko. All leagues were stopped when Russia launched the invasion of the country in February.

254.title: You've respected me as a sister: Kangana on CM Yogi Adityanath's 50th b'day
254.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut shared a post for UP CM Yogi Adityanath on his 50th birthday. Taking to Instagram Stories, Kangana shared a photo of him and wrote, "An eminent leader and a source of inspiration. Someone who has always loved and respected me as a sister. Praying for Yogi's long life and [I] hope his glory shine throughout this world."

255.title: Want to teach school children once or twice a month: MP CM
255.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan has expressed his desire to teach school children. He said, "We should...be ready to play the role of teacher. I also have a desire to visit school once or twice a month and teach children." The CM said this while inaugurating the Learnings from National Achievement Survey workshop at Kushabhau Thakre International Auditorium.

256.title: 8 students hospitalised after having midday meal in Kerala school
256.article_body: Eight students of a government upper primary school in Kerala's Alappuzha were hospitalised when they complained of uneasiness after having their midday meals. "We need to find out whether the food poisoning happened inside the school or not," a food safety official said. State Health Minister Veena George has asked the Food Safety Commissioner to look into the incident.

257.title: Biden plays song 'Butter' during BTS' White House visit; video surfaces
257.article_body: US President Joe Biden has shared a video of him playing South Korean band BTS' song 'Butter' during their visit to the White House on his social media handles. "I figured I'd make you feel at home," Biden said as he played the song. The K-pop group had met Biden last week to discuss the rise in anti-Asian hate crimes.

258.title: 3 kids out to play after lunch get trapped in car in Tamil Nadu, die
258.article_body: Three children aged seven, five and four died of suspected suffocation after they got trapped inside a car while they were playing after lunch on June 4. Reports said that the car's doors could only be opened from outside. The parents of the children found them lying unconscious inside the car and broke into the vehicle with help from passersby.

259.title: Wildfire spreads near Greek capital; houses, cars damaged
259.article_body: Buoyed by intense winds, a wildfire spread on the outskirts of the Greek capital Athens that damaged cars and houses, said the Fire Department. The authorities have ordered evacuation in parts of the Voula and Glyfada regions. More than 130 firefighters, six firefighting aircraft and four helicopters were deployed to control the fire.

260.title: Bhumi participates in a plantation drive in Nainital on World Environment Day
260.article_body: On the occasion of World Environment Day, Bhumi Pednekar planted saplings in Nainital, where she's shooting for her film 'The Ladykiller'. The actress, along with some children from NGO 'SOS Children's Villages of India', also planted saplings in pots that were painted by the children. "This planet is our only home...If we don't keep...[it] safe...we'll not be safe," Bhumi said.

261.title: When I entered stadium, it felt different: CSK's Simarjeet Singh on IPL debut
261.article_body: CSK pacer Simarjeet Singh, who made his IPL debut this season, has revealed that he was "extremely nervous" in his first game against SRH. "When I entered the stadium for the first time, it felt super different," he added. On playing under CSK captain MS Dhoni, Simarjeet said, "I learned how to be calm in pressure situations from Dhoni."

262.title: You did it: Lewandowski to Swiatek after her French Open title win
262.article_body: Taking to Instagram, footballer Robert Lewandowski congratulated Polish Tennis player Iga Swiatek after she won the French Open 2022. "What a match! Congratulations Swiatek, you did it," he wrote. Lewandowski attended the French Open final between Swiatek and Coco Gauff. "Lewandowski's been a top athlete in our country...it's hard to believe that he actually came to watch me," Swiatek stated.

263.title: Tunisian judges to strike for a week after Prez sacks 57 judges
263.article_body: Tunisian judges will hold a week-long strike from Monday and a sit-in protest after the country's President Kais Saied dismissed 57 judges over charges of corruption and protecting terrorists last week. Earlier in February, Saied had also dissolved the Supreme Judicial Council. "The attack was not only against judges, but on the law and freedoms," a judges' association head said.

264.title: RBI may use pics of Rabindranath Tagore, APJ Abdul Kalam on banknotes: Report
264.article_body: In a first, the Finance Ministry and the RBI are considering using watermark figures of Rabindranath Tagore and APJ Abdul Kalam on a new series of banknotes, as per a report. It added that two separate sets of Gandhi, Tagore and Kalam watermarks have been sent to IIT-Delhi Emeritus Professor Dilip T Shahani before a final presentation to the Centre.

265.title: Will summons in name of Nehru be pasted on his memorial?: Shiv Sena
265.article_body: After ED summoned Congress leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi, Shiv Sena in its mouthpiece 'Saamana' asked, "Will a few summons in the name of Nehru be pasted on his memorial?" "In the National Herald case, the transaction was done to repay the loan and not for misconduct...Nehru started this newspaper in the year 1937," Shiv Sena added.

266.title: Man says 'local guy' plans to kill brother, shares video, Hyd Police respond
266.article_body: A Twitter user shared video of a man indulging in violence and said he is a "local guy" who has plans to kill the user's brother. He also shared screenshot of mail sent to Hyderabad Police officer regarding the matter. "We are suffering, please help us," the user wrote. Hyderabad Police tagged SHO Chaderghat and SHO Malakpet in their reply.

267.title: India's trade deficit widens to $23.33 bn in May, exports rise 15%
267.article_body: India's trade deficit widened to $23.33 billion in May 2022, compared with $6.53 billion recorded in May 2021, as imports grew faster than exports. Merchandise exports rose 15.46% to $37.29 billion while imports grew 56.14% to $60.62 billion. While petroleum and crude oil imports rose 91.6% to $18.14 billion, coal imports rose to $5.33 billion in May 2022.

268.title: This was the first time I did intimate scene in any show: Anuritta on Aashram 3
268.article_body: Actress Anuritta K spoke about the pressure due to her show Ek Badnaam Aashram 3's popularity. "This was the first time I did an intimate scene in any...series," she said. "I feel once the series is popular and your character has received so much love, the responsibility increases. Prakash Jha sir was...clear what he wanted out of me," she added.

269.title: Salman Khan meets world's smallest singer, hugs him in viral video
269.article_body: The world's smallest singer Abdu Rozik posted a video on social media of meeting actor Salman Khan and singing 'Ek Ladki Ko Dekha' for him. Abdu wrote alongside the video, "Jab Salman ko deka to esa laga jese apna koyee (When I saw Salman, it felt like someone my own)." Salman can be seen hugging Abdu in the viral video.

270.title: Australia says Chinese aircraft flew dangerously close to its own
270.article_body: Australia has accused a Chinese fighter aircraft of flying dangerously close to its plane during a routine surveillance activity in May. "The intercept resulted in a dangerous manoeuvre which posed a safety threat," said the government. Defence Minister Richard Marles said that the Chinese jet released a "bundle of chaff" containing aluminium pieces that went into the Australian aircraft's engine.

271.title: Documents link Kanpur violence mastermind with radical groups: Police
271.article_body: Police have come across documents linking the alleged mastermind of the Kanpur violence with radical groups, as per senior police officials. The documents were found with the key accused, including Zafar Hayat Hashmi, when they were arrested. Several people, including policemen, were injured in the clash on Friday.

272.title: 3 killed, 11 injured as multiple gunmen open fire on crowd in US' Philadelphia
272.article_body: Three people were killed and 11 were injured after multiple shooters opened fire into a crowd on a popular Philadelphia street, police said. Police officers were patrolling South Street, an area with many restaurants and bars, when "they observed several active shooters shooting into the crowd," Inspector D.F. Pace of the Philadelphia Police Department said.

273.title: I was sexually abused by family friend for 2.5 years as a teen, says Kubbra Sait
273.article_body: Actress Kubbra Sait has revealed in her memoir that she was sexually abused by a friend of her parents when she was 17 years old. "I was being sexually abused and no one in my close perimeter could even tell," Sait wrote. She referred to her abuser as 'X' and said the abuse went on for two-and-a-half years.

274.title: 2019 WC final scene recreated as ball deflects off Stokes' bat in Lord's Test, video viral
274.article_body: A video went viral showing the ball deflecting off Ben Stokes' bat at non-striker's end in Lord's Test against New Zealand, with Joe Root imitating Stokes' hands-up reaction from the 2019 World Cup final. Notably, during the 2019 World Cup final, a throw had deflected off Stokes' bat and raced towards boundary when England needed nine runs to win.

275.title: Lego 'freezes' ops in some Russian stores after supply gets hit due to sanctions
275.article_body: Toymaker Lego's Russian reseller has said it is temporarily "freezing" operations at some of its stores in the country after the sanctions imposed on Moscow impacted its supply network. In March, Lego paused shipments to Russia due to disruptions caused by the Ukraine war. The company has 81 stores in Russia, which are operated by Inventive Retail Group.

276.title: Took me 8yrs to get my first Best Actress award: Kriti on IIFA win
276.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon celebrated her IIFA Best Actress award by posting a series of pictures on Instagram, writing, "Dreams do come true...It's taken me 8yrs to get my first #BestActress award." Kriti won the award for 2021 film 'Mimi'. She further wrote, "Will always be grateful to Dinesh Vijan [and] Laxman Utekar sir for making me your Mimi for life."

277.title: We still back ourselves to take 10 wickets vs England: NZ's Daryl
277.article_body: New Zealand all-rounder Daryl Mitchell, speaking about the ongoing Test match against England, has said, "We still back ourselves to take 10 wickets." "We'll show up tomorrow morning now with the chance to open up an end and get stuck into their bowlers," he stated. Ahead of Day 4, England need 61 runs to win the match.

278.title: 'Vikram' becomes Kamal Haasan's third film to cross ₹100-crore earnings worldwide
278.article_body: Actor Kamal Haasan's 'Vikram' has crossed the ₹100-crore mark globally within two days of its release. It has become the third film to cross the ₹100-crore mark globally in Haasan's career after 'Dasavatharam' and 'Vishwaroopam'. The film, which also stars Vijay Sethupathi, Fahadh Faasil and Suriya, has been directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj.

279.title: Michael B Jordan, Lori Harvey break up after over 1 year of dating: Reports
279.article_body: Actor Michael B Jordan and model Lori Harvey have broken up after dating for more than a year, as per reports. "Michael and Lori are both completely heartbroken," PEOPLE quoted a source as saying. The couple had celebrated their one-year anniversary in November 2021, months after Jordan made their relationship Instagram official that January.

280.title: IFS officer shares questions from UPSC Preliminary exam, asks people to answer
280.article_body: IFS officer Parveen Kaswan shared pictures of questions from UPSC Civil Services Prelim exam and asked people to answer them. What is greenwashing, what is Miyawaki method and which crop is source of methane were among some of the questions shared by Kaswan. He also shared a question which was based on wildlife protection.

281.title: Use brass bottle, wooden brush: Shraddha on World Environment Day
281.article_body: Actress Shraddha Kapoor said everyone should take a pledge to go green and preserve the environment on World Environment Day. She further said we owe a future full of green trees to future generations. "[Use] a brass water bottle instead of a plastic one, a bucket with a mug or a wooden toothbrush instead of a plastic one," Shraddha added.

282.title: 27-yr-old man arrested for stalking ex-classmate in Mumbai: Police
282.article_body: A 27-year-old man was arrested from Mumbai's Khar earlier this week for stalking a woman, police officials said. The woman told the police that the man, who was the woman's classmate in college, had stalked her since 2014. However, the woman filed an FIR against the accused after he approached her twice and even forcibly hugged her last month.

283.title: BJP leader Hans Raj Hans meets Moosewala’s family in Mansa district
283.article_body: BJP leader Hans Raj Hans met the family members of late Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala in Mansa district on Sunday. "I have not come here for any political reasons, I have come here as an artist and as a father," Hans said. Moosewala’s parents met Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday in Chandigarh.

284.title: I'd be in Eng's camp because of old ball: Nasser on Day 4 of Lord's Test
284.article_body: Ex-England captain Nasser Hussain, speaking about the Test match between England and New Zealand, said it has been a new-ball pitch and both teams have struggled against the new ball. He added England will face the old ball on Day 4. "I'd rather be in England's camp because of...old ball, but New Zealand..will be...fighting hard until...last run," he stated.

285.title: Female tennis players should get more prime-time slots: Billie Jean King
285.article_body: Former women's tennis player Billie Jean King has advocated for more prime-time slots for women's tennis in order for the game to get a better audience. "It will stay that way if we don't have more matches (at night)," King said. Notably, only one out of the 10 night matches at this year's French Open was a women's match.

286.title: El Salvador's Arevalo 1st Central American player to win Grand Slam in Paris
286.article_body: El Salvador's Marcelo Arevalo became Central America's first Grand Slam champion on Saturday when he teamed with Netherlands' Jean-Julien Rojer to win French Open men's doubles title. The 12th seeds saved three match points before beating Ivan Dodig and Austin Krajicek 6-7(4-7), 7-6(7-5), 6-3. Notably, the 40-year-old Rojer became the oldest Grand Slam doubles champion in Open Era history.

287.title: B'luru's Baiyappanahalli train terminal to start operations on June 6
287.article_body: Trains will start plying from Baiyappanahalli railway terminal, which is Bengaluru's first fully air-conditioned terminal, from June 6 onwards. It's named after Bharat Ratna recipient Sir M Visvesvaraya and will have seven platforms along with waiting halls, food court, VIP lounge and digital real-time passenger information system. It'll cater to 50,000 passengers commuting in 50 different trains.

288.title: Enough of high-level meetings, Kashmir wants action: Kejriwal
288.article_body: Following targeted killings in Kashmir, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said that the era of 1990 has come again. "Whenever there is a murder in the Valley, news comes that the Home Minister has called a high-level meeting, enough of these meetings, now we need action, Kashmir wants action," Kejriwal added. "They (government) don't have any plans," he stated.

289.title: UP farmer falsely framed for 'cow slaughter'; policeman suspended
289.article_body: A 32-year-old farmer, Nawab Ali, in UP's Moradabad was booked and arrested for allegedly taking a cow for slaughter. However, he was released by a court after no evidence was found against him. His wife, Rabia Khatoon, said the police falsely framed him in the case. Sub-inspector Subhash Chandra, who filed the FIR against the man, has been suspended.

290.title: Fire breaks out at Jammu police station, several seized vehicles gutted
290.article_body: At least seven cars and over a dozen two-wheelers seized by police were burnt after a fire broke out on the Satwari police station premises in Jammu on Sunday, officials said. The fire broke out in an open area housing the vehicles after an overhead power line snapped, they added. Four fire engines were rushed to the spot.

291.title: Beer prices surge to £8 per pint for the first time ever in London
291.article_body: The price of a pint of beer has reached £8 (about ₹775) for the first time ever in London amid rising inflation, according to research from industry tracker CGA. Meanwhile, the average price of a pint of beer in UK has increased to £3.95. Beer prices in UK have risen over 70% since the financial crisis of 2008, CGA said.

292.title: Explosion that killed 13 at factory in UP's Hapur caught on CCTV
292.article_body: The explosion at a chemical factory in Uttar Pradesh's Hapur, that killed 13 people, has been captured on a CCTV camera. The footage shows objects flying in the air following the explosion. Smoke and dust were seen filling the air, which reduced the visibility of the surrounding area. At least 20 other persons have sustained injuries in the incident.

293.title: Want Kohli to break Tendulkar's centuries record: Rohit Sharma's coach
293.article_body: Rohit Sharma's childhood coach Dinesh Lad called Virat Kohli a "wonderful batsman" and added that Kohli will make a "strong comeback". "I think it's more about mental strength rather than form. Kohli should concentrate on that. Rest he'll bat well, we can't talk much about that. I want him to break Sachin Tendulkar's century record," he added.

294.title: Actors Prabhas, Yash attend 'KGF' director's b'day party, pics go viral
294.article_body: Actors Prabhas and Yash attended filmmaker Prashanth Neel's birthday party. The pictures of the duo from the party have gone viral on social media. "These are the moments to remember forever," a Twitter user wrote. "Bosses together," another user wrote. Prashanth, who directed Yash's 'KGF' franchise, will direct Prabhas in his upcoming film 'Salaar'.

295.title: People from outside not responsible for Delhi's pollution: Gopal Rai
295.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai on Sunday said that people from outside "are not responsible for the pollution problem in Delhi" and that Delhi's residents need to cut down their own share of pollution. Delhi government is taking all steps it can to protect the environment but "there's a need to do more", he said and added, "We can improve."

296.title: Maha Metro completes excavation of 12 km tunnel in Pune in 9 months
296.article_body: Maha Metro on Saturday completed the excavation of a 12 km underground tunnel between Swargate and Budhwar Peth in Pune after work began nearly nine months ago. "Due to the technical expertise and sound project management, the tunnelling work has been completed without any hindrance," a metro official said. Pune Metro Rail also shared pictures of the breakthrough on Twitter.

297.title: Supporter prepares 111-ft cake on UP CM Yogi's 50th birthday
297.article_body: A supporter of Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath in Bareilly has prepared a 111-feet cake for his 50th birthday. The cake will weigh 40 quintals and it'll be mounted in phases and supported by 150 quintals of iron structure. The man, Amir Zaidi, will attempt to create a world record with the cake, which will be called 'cake of peace'.

298.title: Kagiso Rabada is a very big threat for Team India in SA T20Is: Irfan
298.article_body: Former India cricketer Irfan Pathan has termed SA pacer Kagiso Rabada as a "very big threat" for Team India in their upcoming T20I series against the Temba Bavuma-led side. "Rabada has regained the form he had lost a little. He is an extremely quality bowler...You can use him like Bumrah is used by the Indian team," added Irfan.

299.title: Won't quit Cong, up to them to throw me out: Sunil Jakhar's nephew
299.article_body: BJP leader Sunil Jakhar's nephew and Congress MLA Sandeep Jakhar has said that he'll not resign from his post and if Congress wants to "throw [him] out, it's up to them". This comes after Punjab Congress chief Amarinder Singh Raja Warring told Sunil to make Sandeep quit as MLA and join BJP. The remark shows Congress leadership's "arrogance", Sandeep added.

300.title: CEC Rajiv Kumar treks 18 km to remote polling booths in U'khand
300.article_body: Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) Rajiv Kumar trekked for 18 kilometres on Friday to the remote polling booths of Uttarakhand to assess the challenges faced by polling parties in hilly areas. Kumar visited Dhumak and Kalgoth, the most remote polling booths of Uttarakhand located in Chamoli. "Polling parties have to walk three days to reach here," Kumar said.

301.title: Former Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis tests COVID-19 positive
301.article_body: Former Maharashtra Chief Minister and BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis on Sunday tested positive for coronavirus. "Taking medication and treatment as per doctor's advice," Fadnavis said in a tweet, adding that he is currently under home isolation. "Those who have come in contact with me are advised to get COVID-19 tests done," he further said.

302.title: Putin holds festival honouring rumoured girlfriend Alina amid war, video released
302.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin reportedly held a gymnastic festival honouring his rumoured girlfriend and gymnast Alina Kabaeva, amid the Russian war on Ukraine. The 'Alina Festival', which was reportedly held last month, was aired on Russian state TV on June 1. The broadcast showed young children and gymnasts performing choreographed routines on stage at the festival.

303.title: I'm going to court: Pak singer on Karan Johar's 'Nach Punjaban' song
303.article_body: Pakistani singer Abrar Ul Haq posted a video on Twitter on Saturday saying that he will sue Karan Johar and T-Series for allegedly stealing his song 'Nach Punjaban' for 'Jugjugg Jeeyo'. Abrar said merely giving credit is not enough as he never sold his song. "It belongs to me and I'll get it back...I'm coming to the court," he added.

304.title: We denounce insult of religious personalities: BJP after its leader's remarks on Prophet
304.article_body: After violence broke out in Uttar Pradesh over BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's remarks on Prophet Muhammad, the party released a statement saying, "BJP strongly denounces insult of any religious personalities of any religion." "The BJP is also strongly against any ideology which insults or demeans any sect or religion. The BJP does not promote such people or philosophy," it added.

305.title: I don't party as I sleep by 11 pm, people think I'm uncool: Esha Gupta
305.article_body: Actress Esha Gupta said in an interview that people think she's "uncool" because she doesn't go to parties and sleep by 11 pm. "I'm one of those whose priority isn't partying...I want to wake up early," she added. Esha also spoke about her growth in the industry and said, "It has taken...time to reach where I am as a person."

306.title: Family of brain-dead girl donates heart, saves 14-yr-old Pune boy's life
306.article_body: The family members of a 14-year-old brain-dead girl donated her heart to a boy of the same age suffering from a severe cardiac condition, thereby saving his life. The transplant surgery was carried out at Pune's Army Institute of Cardio-Thoracic Sciences (AICTS). A green corridor was established for seamless transport of the donor's heart to AICTS within 11 minutes.

307.title: Death toll rises to 13 in UP's Hapur factory blast; 2 booked for culpable homicide
307.article_body: The death toll in factory blast in Uttar Pradesh's Hapur has increased to 13. The owner and director of the factory have been booked for culpable homicide. Police said 33 people were working inside the factory and 20 people who survived have sustained injuries. Police added that what material exploded will be clear after FSL report.

308.title: Dynamic CM: PM Modi on UP CM Yogi Adityanath's 50th birthday
308.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday wished UP CM Yogi Adityanath on his 50th birthday and called him a "dynamic CM". "Under his able leadership, the state has scaled new heights of progress. He has ensured pro-people governance to the people of the state," PM Modi tweeted. "Praying for his long and healthy life in service of the people," he added.

309.title: Shiv Sena to put up MLAs at Mumbai hotel ahead of Rajya Sabha polls
309.article_body: In a bid to avoid poaching, Shiv Sena has asked all its MLAs to stay at a hotel in Mumbai ahead of the Rajya Sabha elections, which will conclude on June 10. The decision was taken "as a precautionary measure", a senior party leader said. "They have been told to come to Mumbai on June 8," the leader added.

310.title: We made an honest film, India has embraced it: Producer Mahesh Babu on Major
310.article_body: Mahesh Babu, who has produced Adivi Sesh-starrer film 'Major', wrote on Twitter, "Thank you for the overwhelming response to #Major." "We made an honest film and India has embraced it...A must watch for every Indian," he added. 'Major' is based on the life of NSG commando Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan, who was martyred in the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks.

311.title: Have to love Trump's branding: Ashneer on 'Biden did that' sticker at US petrol pump
311.article_body: BharatPe's former Managing Director Ashneer Grover took to Twitter to share a picture of 'Biden did that' sticker featuring former US President Donald Trump at a petrol pump in the US. Grover wrote, "Politics is same everywhere...here in US Trump is savvy sticking these things at petrol pumps." He further said, "Have to love Trump's branding."

312.title: Warner, Finch are back, it means I probably won't start: Head on SL ODIs
312.article_body: Australia batter Travis Head has said he probably won't start in their upcoming ODI series against Sri Lanka as David Warner and Aaron Finch are also in the squad. "[We've] also got a middle-order that's so set in that...it's a hard one to get into," he added. Australia will play three T20Is, five ODIs and two Tests in Sri Lanka.

313.title: India achieved 10% ethanol blending in petrol target 5 months before deadline: PM
313.article_body: On World Environment Day, PM Narendra Modi announced that India has achieved the target of 10% ethanol blending in petrol five months before the deadline. He added that it has also reduced carbon emissions by 27 lakh tonnes. The ethanol blending programme is aimed at reducing the country's dependence on crude oil imports, cutting carbon emissions and boosting farmers' incomes.

314.title: Akshay's 'Samrat Prithviraj' sends out message India needs: RSS chief
314.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat attended the special screening of Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj'. Speaking about the film, he said, "It is a fact-based movie and rightly sends out the message the country needs today." "We used to read our history written by others. Now, we're looking at history from India's perspective," he added. The film also features Manushi Chhillar.

315.title: 13 cabinet ministers, 8 state ministers take oath in Odisha cabinet reshuffle
315.article_body: As part of cabinet reshuffle in Odisha, 13 cabinet ministers and 8 ministers with independent charge took oath on Sunday in Bhubaneswar in presence of state Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik. BJD MLAs Jagannath Saraka, Niranjan Pujari and R P Swain were among 13 MLAs who were administered oath. Meanwhile, three women legislators have been inducted into cabinet.

316.title: Akshay Kumar's 'Samrat Prithviraj' earns ₹23.3 crore in two days
316.article_body: Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj has earned ₹23.3 crore in its first two days of release. While the film had grossed ₹10.7 crore on Friday, it collected ₹12.6 crore on Saturday. The film, written and directed by Chandraprakash Dwivedi, is based on the life and times of Rajput emperor Prithviraj Chauhan.

317.title: Our anti-aircraft systems are crunching enemy arms like nuts: Putin
317.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin said during an interview that the country's anti-aircraft systems are "crunching" enemy weapons "like nuts" and that "dozens have been destroyed". The statement was first reported by the state news agency RIA. This comes as Russia claimed that it had shot down a Ukrainian plane carrying weapons and also struck a "foreign mercenaries" outpost near Odesa.

318.title: SRK graduated from same school: Naukri.com Founder as he shares his school certificate
318.article_body: Naukri.com Founder Sanjeev Bikhchandani took to Twitter to share a photo of his character certificate from St Columba's School in New Delhi, dated June 8, 1981. The certificate stated he was "punctual in attendance and diligent in studies". He later went on to reveal that four years later,  actor Shah Rukh Khan too graduated from the same school.

319.title: Sunil Jakhar should make nephew quit as MLA, join BJP: Punjab Cong chief
319.article_body: Punjab Congress chief Amarinder Singh Raja Warring told Indian Express that if BJP leader Sunil Jakhar feels that he is a "big and popular leader", then he should make his nephew and Congress MLA Sandeep Jakhar quit his post and join BJP. However, Warring claimed that Sunil would not do so because he knows that "Sandeep will lose the bypoll".

320.title: BJP leader shares video, claims MLA's son involved in case of minor's gangrape in Hyd
320.article_body: BJP MLA M Raghunandan Rao has shared a video alleging that an AIMIM MLA's son is involved in the case of a minor's gangrape in Hyderabad. Police had said that the MLA's son was not present at the time of the alleged crime. Meanwhile, Inspector S Rajashekhar Reddy said four accused have been arrested while the fifth accused is absconding.

321.title: I want to say something to Ukraine, stay strong: Swiatek after French Open win
321.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek gave a message to war-hit Ukraine in her on-court interview after winning the French Open title. "I want to say something to Ukraine. Stay strong, the world is still there," she stated. The 21-year-old Polish tennis player defeated 18-year-old Coco Gauff in the final with a scoreline of 6-1, 6-3.

322.title: Those protesting against mining should first stop using AC: Chhattisgarh CM
322.article_body: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel said those who are trying to politicise mining issue should first stop using electricity and air-conditioner, fan and cooler and then fight for the cause. "Those who are protesting...should first switch off power at their house," he said, adding, "People are claiming 8 lakh trees will be cut...only 8,000 trees will be cut this year."

323.title: Colombian Prez faces house arrest for failing to save national park
323.article_body: A Colombian court sentenced President Ivan Duque to five days' house arrest and imposed a fine of around $4,000 for failing to comply with a Supreme Court order to protect a national park. Duque was held guilty of contempt of court for not taking measures to protect the Los Nevados National Park. He called the order unconstitutional.

324.title: Karthik has to perform against SA to remain in contention for T20 WC: Ravi
324.article_body: Former India coach Ravi Shastri has said that wicket-keeper batter Dinesh Karthik has to perform in his comeback series against South Africa in order to remain in contention for a spot in this year's T20 World Cup. "This is his (Karthik) opportunity...when he gets an opportunity in these games, he has to do it with India colours on," Shastri said.

325.title: Philippines sounds alert after restive volcano spews cloud of ash
325.article_body: The Philippines sounded an alert after a restive volcano at Mount Bulusan spewed a cloud of ash about 1 km into the sky on Sunday. The alert level was raised from zero to one on a five-point scale. According to the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology, 77 volcanic earthquakes were recorded in a 24-hour period before the eruption.

326.title: Actor Aditya Roy Kapur tests positive for COVID-19: Report
326.article_body: Actor Aditya Roy Kapur has reportedly tested positive for COVID-19 and has mild symptoms. According to a report by ETimes, the trailer launch event of his upcoming film 'Om: The Battle Within' has been rescheduled after the actor contracted the virus. The film is scheduled to release on July 1. Earlier, Kartik Aaryan also tested positive for COVID-19.

327.title: Miandad said 'Why are you looking at Audi? You won't get it': Shastri on 1985 WCC final
327.article_body: Recalling 1985 WCC final against Pakistan, Ravi Shastri revealed when India required 15-20 runs to win, Javed Miandad taunted him while he was looking at field setting. "Miandad said, 'Why are you looking at Audi? You aren't...getting it'," Shastri said. He added, "I told him, 'It's coming my way'." Shastri was awarded the car for being player of the tournament.

328.title: Ukraine's Kyiv rocked with multiple explosions, says mayor
328.article_body: Ukraine's Kyiv was rocked by multiple explosions, said Mayor Vitali Klitschko on Sunday. "Several explosions [occurred] in Darnytskyi and Dniprovskyi districts of the capital," Klitschko wrote on the Telegram app. "Services are already working on site. More detailed information - later," he added. This comes a day after Ukraine claimed to have recaptured parts of the Sievierodonetsk city.

329.title: I'm scrambling to get something: Candidate whose job offer Coinbase revoked
329.article_body: Coinbase on Friday extended its hiring freeze and also revoked some accepted job offers. One such candidate, a college graduate, who was supposed to join the company in September, said, "Now I'm scrambling to get something and most companies are either filled up or have frozen hiring." The candidate had passed on three job offers to work for Coinbase.

330.title: Nayanthara, Vignesh meet TN CM Stalin; invite him to their wedding
330.article_body: Actress Nayanthara and director Vignesh Shivan met Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin recently and invited him to their wedding. The duo will reportedly tie the knot on June 9 at a resort in Mahabalipuram, Tamil Nadu. "It will be low-key in presence of close friends and family members followed by a lavish wedding reception in Chennai," reports stated.

331.title: Lt Col booked for domestic violence in Ambala on complaint of officer wife
331.article_body: Police have booked a Lieutenant Colonel in Ambala for domestic violence and breach of trust on his wife's complaint. According to the complainant, an Army Major, after they got married, she discovered that contrary to his claims, his mother was alive and he had a widowed sister. She also accused him of dowry harassment and beating up their two children.

332.title: Over 12,000 MGNREGA workers resign en masse in Chhattisgarh
332.article_body: Over 12,000 contractual workers of the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA) scheme resigned en masse on Saturday in Chhattisgarh. The decision was taken after the state government suddenly terminated the services of 21 MGNREGA  assistant project officers and over the workers' demands, an MGNREGA workers' union leader said. MGNREGA workers were on strike since April.

333.title: Actor Ahan Shetty, son of Suniel Shetty, wins Best Debut Male at IIFA 2022
333.article_body: Actor Ahan Shetty, son of Suniel Shetty, won the Best Debut Male award at the International Indian Film Academy Awards (IIFA) 2022. He won the award for his performance in Milan Luthria's 'Tadap'. Meanwhile, the Best Debut Female award went to Sharvari Wagh for the film 'Bunty Aur Babli 2'. IIFA was held in Abu Dhabi on June 4.

334.title: 4 held for possessing tiger hide, claws in Madhya Pradesh's Mandla
334.article_body: Police arrested four poachers with the help of a tip-off in Madhya Pradesh's Mandla district on Saturday. Notably, the skin of a tiger, its claws and four teeth of a wild boar have been seized by the police. The accused are identified as Makhanlal Yadav (40), Anand Kushram (30), Manoj Pandram (32) and Itwari Posham (27).

335.title: 35 killed, 450 injured in huge fire at container depot in Bangladesh
335.article_body: At least 35 people have died after a huge fire broke out at a shipping container depot in Bangladesh's Chittagong last night. The fire has left about 450 people injured. According to police officer Nurul Alam, a preliminary probe indicated that the fire broke out due to a chemical reaction while local media reported that it spread following an explosion.

336.title: Pooja Hegde joins Deverakonda in Puri Jagannadh's 'JGM'; shooting begins
336.article_body: Actress Pooja Hegde is set to share screen space with Vijay Deverakonda in 'JGM', an upcoming film which will be directed by Puri Jagannadh and produced by Charmme Kaur. The film, scheduled to release in theatres on August 3 next year, went on floors on Saturday. 'JGM' will be released in Telugu, Hindi, Tamil, Kannada and Malayalam.

337.title: I don't think there was a need for a break for Rohit: RP Singh
337.article_body: Ex-India pacer RP Singh has said there was no need to rest India captain Rohit Sharma for the upcoming home T20I series against South Africa. "Taking rest or not is his personal thought...But I don't think there was a need...He should have played. It's a long series," stated Singh. The five-match T20I series will begin on June 9.

338.title: Assam Police officer who arrested fiance for fraud held in case related to him
338.article_body: Assam Police officer Junmoni Rabha, who had got her fiance arrested on fraud charges last month, has now been arrested in connection with a case related to him. Reports said that the arrest was made by the Majuli Police on various charges, including criminal conspiracy and cheating. Police interrogated Rabha after her name appeared in FIRs.

339.title: North Korea fires 8 ballistic missiles in 35 minutes: Seoul
339.article_body: North Korea fired at least eight suspected ballistic missiles off its east coast within a span of 35 minutes, the South Korean military said on Sunday. The missiles were launched from the Sunan area in Pyongyang into the East Sea (Sea of Japan), said Seoul's Joint Chiefs of Staff. Japanese Defence Minister Nobuo Kishi said, "This is absolutely unacceptable."

340.title: 5 killed, including 3 children, after car collides with truck in Maharashtra
340.article_body: A car rammed into a stationary truck leading to the death of all five people in the car on the Pune-Bengaluru highway in Maharashtra's Sangli district. The deceased, which included three children, were members of one family. Notably, the deceased were identified as Arinjay Shirote (35), Smita Shirote (38), Purva Shirote (14), Sunesha Shirote (10) and Viru Shirote (4).

341.title: Abhishek Bachchan, Salman Khan spotted together at IIFA Awards 2022, pic goes viral
341.article_body: A picture of actors Abhishek Bachchan and Salman Khan sitting with UAE Minister of Culture, Youth, and Social Development Nahyan bin Mubarak Al Nahyan at the IIFA Awards 2022 has gone viral. Reacting to the picture, a fan wrote, "This is the pic of the year." Meanwhile, another fan called it an "awkward moment".

342.title: Harbhajan Singh names his Team of IPL 2022
342.article_body: Former India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh has named his Team of IPL 2022. He has included Hardik Pandya as captain. He has named Jos Buttler and KL Rahul as the openers and Dinesh Karthik as the wicketkeeper. Other players include Rahul Tripathi, Liam Livingstone, Andre Russell, Yuzvendra Chahal, Rashid Khan, Umran Malik and Josh Hazlewood.

343.title: Wanted to have a Tennis record but it's hard after Serena's career: Iga
343.article_body: Tennis player Iga Swiatek went past Serena Williams' 34-match unbeaten run after winning the French Open 2022. Iga equalled Venus Williams' record of the 35-match win streak. Speaking about it, she said, "Having that 35th win...doing something more than Serena did, it's...special." "Because I...wanted...to have some kind of a record. In tennis, it's pretty hard after Serena's career," she added.

344.title: I intentionally wanted to hit Sachin to wound him at any cost: Akhtar on 2006 Test
344.article_body: Recalling India-Pakistan 2006 Karachi Test, ex-Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar said, "I'm revealing this for the first time. I intentionally wanted to hit Sachin in that Test." He added, "I was determined that I had to wound Sachin in that Test at any cost." He added he hit Sachin's helmet once, but, Sachin managed to save his head.

345.title: Ukraine minister criticises Macron's 'don't humiliate' Russia call
345.article_body: Ukraine's Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba on Sunday reacted to French President Emmanuel Macron's warning against "humiliating" Russia, saying, "Calls to avoid humiliation of Russia can only humiliate France and every other country that'd call for it." Macron had said that this should be done for post-war diplomatic efforts. "We...better focus on how to put Russia in its place," Kuleba added.

346.title: Kashmir is burning but important people of Delhi promoting films: Raut
346.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Sunday said that Kashmir is "burning" again and the situation there is out of control. "Important people of Delhi (central government) are busy promoting films," Raut added. "No one is willing to listen to the Kashmiris. The Kashmiri Pandits are forced to agitate, what is the government doing?" Raut asked.

347.title: Man given life imprisonment ’till last breath’ in murder case in Gurgaon
347.article_body: A man, Nofil Anwar, was sentenced to life imprisonment "till last breath" by a Gurgaon Court for stabbing a security guard and killing him in a private hospital in 2019. "If...awarded...simply life imprisonment...he...will be released from custody after 14 years...but...such culprit is required to be kept behind the bars till the end of his life," court said.

348.title: Delhi minister scolds officials over lack of AC for public; video surfaces
348.article_body: A video of Delhi minister Kailash Gahlot scolding officials over the lack of AC for public at a government office in the national capital has surfaced online. "Should we get the ACs removed in your rooms?" he questioned the officials. Furthermore, Gahlot reacted to the incident, saying, "[Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal] says that it's our duty to provide facilities to...public."

349.title: Ronaldo wins Man United's Player of the Year award for record-equalling 4th time
349.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo has won the Manchester United's Sir Matt Busby Player of the Year award for a record-equalling fourth time in his career. David de Gea is the only other United player who has won the award four times. Ronaldo scored 24 goals across competitions in the 2021-22 season, finishing only behind Son Heung-min and Mohamed Salah in Premier League.

350.title: Raghav Chadha says 'Send officers to tribal affairs as punishment posting'; criticised
350.article_body: In an interview, AAP MP Raghav Chadha said, "You can't fire government officials. You can only transfer them. If someone is working very well, you'll give them a good department...And if someone is doing a bad job, send them to tribal affairs as punishment posting." "I'm ashamed that I ever saw hope in youngsters like Raghav Chadha," said Yogendra Yadav.
