351.title: Led by RIL, 4 of top 10 valued firms add ₹2.31 lakh cr in m-cap in past week
351.article_body: Four of the top 10 most valued domestic firms together added ₹2,31,320.37 crore in market valuation in the past week. While Reliance Industries contributed the most with a valuation jump of ₹1,38,222.46 crore to ₹18,80,350.47 crore, it was followed by TCS whose valuation zoomed by ₹64,618.85 crore to ₹12,58,274.59 crore. Infosys and ICICI Bank were the other gainers.

352.title: Tip of iceberg: Former CM as 4 ex-Punjab Cong ministers join BJP
352.article_body: After four former Punjab Congress ministers joined BJP on Saturday, ex-Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh said, "This is just the tip of the iceberg!" His remark came as Balbir Singh Sidhu, Raj Kumar Verka, Sunder Sham Arora and Gurpreet Singh Kangar joined the BJP in Chandigarh in Union Home Minister Amit Shah’s presence, yesterday.

353.title: 1 killed, 7 injured in shooting at graduation party in US
353.article_body: A 20-year-old man was killed and seven others, aged from 16 to 21 years, were injured in a shooting that took place at a graduation party in US' Virginia, said police. The police recovered over 50 casings of four different calibers. "Whether that means it was four people shooting, I can't tell you that," said a police official.

354.title: Pak security forces on alert amid rumours of Imran's murder plot
354.article_body: The security agencies in Pakistan's Islamabad have reportedly been put on high alert amid rumours of assassination plot against former PM Imran Khan. Khan is expected to arrive in Bani Gala, a residential area located in the capital, on Sunday. Section 144 has been imposed in Islamabad and gatherings have been banned, according to police.

355.title: Over 40,000 motorists penalised in a special drive in Mumbai on Friday
355.article_body: In a special drive conducted by the Mumbai Traffic Police on Friday, around 40,320 motorists were penalised in the city for violating traffic rules. Out of 40,320 motorists, 9,847 were penalised for no parking while 3,310 were fined for honking, police said. Notably, a total of 1,842 police personnel were deployed to conduct the special drive.

356.title: Police gets access to CCTV footage in Delhi metro sexual harassment case
356.article_body: After a woman took to Twitter to share an incident of sexual harassment that took place with her at Delhi's Jor Bagh metro station, Delhi Metro authorities have said that they have shared the CCTV footage of the incident with the Delhi Police. The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) has also said that they have zero tolerance toward such incidents.

357.title: How many people thought this was okay: Priyanka on body spray ads having gang rape jokes
357.article_body: Reacting to deodorant advertisements by Layer'r Shot which were accused of promoting rape culture and gang rape, Priyanka Chopra tweeted, "Shameful and disgusting. How many levels of clearances did it take for this commercial to be green lit?" She added, "How many people thought this was ok? I’m so glad...it was called out and...the ministry has taken it down. Appalling!"

358.title: Traffic police officer slaps Swiggy delivery agent in viral video in TN, transferred
358.article_body: A traffic police officer in Tamil Nadu was transferred after he was caught on camera slapping a Swiggy delivery agent. The agent was questioning the driver of a school bus who was driving rash and was about to hit a pedestrian, which led to a traffic jam. The policeman also snatched the delivery agent's phone and damaged his motorcycle.

359.title: Hours after party brawl, IPS officer removed as Dwarka DCP
359.article_body: Hours after IPS officer Shankar Choudhary was accused of hitting a woman with a glass at a birthday party in Delhi, he was "relieved from his duty as DCP (Dwarka)". The Police PRO, however, did not say if the order, which was issued by the Delhi Police Commissioner, was related to the party brawl.

360.title: I feel like her blood is still on me: Teacher on Hindu colleague shot dead in J&K
360.article_body: Remembering late Rajni Bala, the 36-year-old Hindu school teacher shot dead by terrorists in Kashmir recently, her colleague Shahida Maqbool said, "I feel like her blood is still on me." Another teacher Saima Akhtar said, "She had been shot in the head. I tied her own dupatta around the wound trying to stop the blood while I screamed for help."

361.title: Dream come true to be on screen with you: Suriya to 'Vikram' co-star Haasan
361.article_body: Actor Suriya, who plays a cameo role in Kamal Haasan and Lokesh Kanagaraj's film 'Vikram', wrote on Twitter, "Dearest Kamal Haasan Anna...This is a dream come true to be on screen with you..!" "Thank you for making this happen! Overwhelmed to see all the love," he added. The action thriller film also stars Vijay Sethupathi and Fahadh Faasil.

362.title: Burning people jumped into drains for water contact: Hapur fire witness
362.article_body: Shyam Sundar, a man who works near the factory where fire broke out in Uttar Pradesh's Hapur, said there were people bleeding and burning and running out of factory. "[They were] jumping in drains...hoping for some contact with water," Sundar said. Another man who works near the factory injured his arm as material reportedly came flying out of the factory.

363.title: England lose to Hungary for 1st time in 60 years
363.article_body: England lost 0-1 to Hungary in their UEFA Nations League opener as Hungary's Dominik Szoboszlai converted a penalty after being fouled by Reece James. Notably, this is the first time in 60 years that Hungary have beaten England. "We have to accept that we did not do enough to win the game," said England coach Gareth Southgate.

364.title: Novak Djokovic is absolute favourite at Wimbledon: Djokovic's coach
364.article_body: Tennis player Novak Djokovic's coach Goran Ivanisevic has said that the Serbian player must rest well and prepare "physically and mentally" for Wimbledon 2022.  "Djokovic is the absolute favourite at Wimbledon, as is Rafael Nadal here," Goran stated. "I'm sure he can do it and I think he [Djokovic] will win it, I have a good feeling," he added.

365.title: Bicycles left by migrant workers during lockdown auctioned for ₹21.2 lakh in UP
365.article_body: Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur district administration has auctioned 5,400 bicycles left behind by migrant workers while they rushed home during the COVID-19 lockdown, said a senior official. A total of ₹21.2 lakh was collected, said the SDM. The SDM added that while 14,600 labourers collected their bicycles from Saharanpur, 5,400 bicycles were getting rusted over the past two years.

366.title: Satyendar Jain can't have lawyer during ED questioning: Delhi HC
366.article_body: The Delhi High Court stayed a trial court order that allowed Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain to have his lawyer present during the questioning by ED in a money laundering case. The HC noted that since there is no FIR against Jain and he has only been called for questioning, he cannot claim the right to have his lawyer present.

367.title: I don't take it as pressure: Saiee Manjrekar on being a star kid
367.article_body: Actress Saiee Manjrekar, speaking about the pressure of being a star kid, has said, "I don't take it as pressure. Instead, it's more like motivation to put in more efforts." However, Saiee added that she should make her father Mahesh Manjrekar proud in "every step of the way". Saiee made her Bollywood debut in Salman Khan-starrer 'Dabangg 3'.

368.title: Not necessary to meet him every time: Chavan on 'haven’t met Rahul in 4 yrs'
368.article_body: Ex-Maharashtra CM and Congress leader Prithviraj Chavan has issued a clarification over his remark "haven’t met Rahul Gandhi in the last four years." "He had resigned from his post in the organisation…He’s opposing PM Narendra Modi in his own way and going across the nation and abroad. Not necessary to meet him every time," the Congress G-23 group member added.

369.title: Curfew imposed in Bareilly till July 3 after violence in UP's Kanpur
369.article_body: After clashes broke out between two groups in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur on Friday, curfew under section 144 has been imposed in Bareilly till July 3. The decision comes after call for protest to be held on June 10 as announced by Muslim cleric Tauqeer Raza. Administration said not more than five people will be allowed to assemble in public place.

370.title: Doctors treat patients using phone light due to power cut in Bihar
370.article_body: Doctors at Sadar Hospital in Bihar's Rohtas used the light from their phones to treat critical patients due to a sudden power outage, a civil surgeon said. The civil surgeon added that the incident took place on Friday night. District Magistrate Dharmendra Kumar said that following complaints, a show-cause notice was issued with directions to solve the problems immediately.

371.title: Man kills 22-yr-old live-in partner on suspicion of cheating in Gurugram
371.article_body: A 25-year-old man, identified as Rahul, stabbed his 22-year-old live-in partner to death using a kitchen knife on suspicion of cheating in Gurugram, said police. He then called the police to inform about the murder, following which he was arrested. The woman had reportedly separated from her husband three years ago and soon started living with Rahul.

372.title: Vlogger Roddur Roy abuses Mamata Banerjee over KK's last concert, police case filed
372.article_body: A case has been filed against vlogger Roddur Roy for abusing West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee in a Facebook Live over late singer KK's last concert. Roddur used expletives as he blamed the ruling party, alleging mismanagement at singer KK's last concert in Nazrul Mancha. KK passed away aged 53 due to a suspected cardiac arrest after the concert.

373.title: India reports 4,270 COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, active cases rise to 24,052
373.article_body: India has reported 4,270 COVID-19 cases, 2,619 recoveries and 15 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,962 COVID-19 cases and 26 deaths. Active cases in India increased to 24,052, while the death toll reached 5,24,692.

374.title: It shouldn't have happened, there was no need: Harbhajan on slapping Sreesanth in 2008
374.article_body: Talking about slapping Sreesanth in IPL 2008, Harbhajan Singh said, "What happened was wrong. I made a mistake. Because of me, he had to face embarrassment. I was embarrassed." He added, "If I had to correct one mistake...it was how I treated Sreesanth. It shouldn't have happened. When I think about it...I feel there was no need," Harbhajan said.

375.title: Abbott resumes production at Michigan plant amid shortage of baby formula in US
375.article_body: Abbott is restarting baby formula production at its Michigan plant after its shutdown led to a shortage of baby food in the US. The Michigan plant, one of America's largest, was closed in February after reports of bacterial contamination found in its formula products. The company said that the facility met initial government sanitary requirements for reopening.

376.title: Was heartbreaking: Tiger Shroff on Heropanti 2's box office failure
376.article_body: Actor Tiger Shroff said that the box office failure of his film 'Heropanti 2' was "definitely heartbreaking". "I'm extremely connected to all my movies. So it takes a toll on me every time if a film doesn't work. I bounce back by immersing myself in work," he added. Tiger will next be seen in 'Ganapath' and 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan'.

377.title: Feeling very dull after Sidhu Moosewala, KK's deaths: Amit Sadh
377.article_body: Actor Amit Sadh has said he has been feeling "very dull" after the deaths of Sidhu Moosewala and KK. "Of course, we have to live life, move on and be happy. But, at this time, I'm just a little troubled with what's been going around," he added. On being asked about his favourite song sung by KK, Amit named 'Pal'.

378.title: I've got really good feeling about it: Broad on winning prospects vs NZ on Day 4
378.article_body: With England needing 61 runs to win the ongoing Test against New Zealand at Lord's on Day 4, England pacer Stuart Broad said he's got a "really good feeling about [it]". NZ were restricted to 285 in their second innings after they lost their last six wickets for 34 runs. England's Joe Root is unbeaten at the crease at 77*(131).

379.title: 13-yr-old boy has surgery in Delhi, regains ability to eat, speak after 7 yrs
379.article_body: A 13-year-old boy from Rajasthan regained his ability to speak, eat food, and breathe on his own after he had surgery in Delhi. Reports said during surgery, doctors removed a breathing pipe that had been placed in his airway seven years ago. The boy had fell off a roof and was in coma for two weeks, when pipe was placed.

380.title: Bengaluru police clear traffic jam after person raises complaint
380.article_body: Bengaluru's Madivala Traffic Police Station on Sunday shared a picture and tweeted that traffic jam, caused due to an accident and rain, at Roopena Agrahara was cleared following a complaint by a person from a news agency. The person tweeted that "haphazardly parked" private buses were causing the traffic jam. The person also tagged the city's Police Commissioner in tweet.

381.title: Was going to ask if you're Anupam Kher: Driver to actor taking ride in his auto
381.article_body: An autorickshaw driver told actor Anupam Kher that he was going to ask him if he was the actor while Kher took a ride in his autorickshaw after morning walk. In a video shared by Kher, the actor can be seen asking the driver's name. He can also be seen meeting kids at traffic signal and giving sweets to them.

382.title: 1st ever population study of dolphins around Mumbai coast gets commissioned
382.article_body: The Maharashtra forest department's Mangrove Foundation is going to conduct the first-ever dolphin population estimation exercise across coastal waters of the Mumbai Metropolitan Region. The decision was taken after it was revealed in a study that South Mumbai's Backbay area resulted in 27 sightings of Indian Ocean humpback dolphins. Notably, the study will begin post-monsoon, an official said.

383.title: Policeman injured after 2 car thieves attack with knife in Pune
383.article_body: A policeman was allegedly injured in a knife attack by two thieves who were trying to escape with a stolen car in Pune on Friday. The police were chasing the thieves after a complaint by the car owner. When they tried to stop the perpetrators, they were attacked. Taking advantage of darkness, the thieves dropped their weapons and ran away.

384.title: Actor Adivi Sesh does his magic once again: Allu Arjun on 'Major'
384.article_body: Taking to Twitter, actor Allu Arjun praised Adivi Sesh-starrer 'Major'. "A very heart-touching film. Man of the show Adivi does his magic once again," he stated." "Big congratulations and my personal respect to the producer Mahesh Babu for giving the audience such a heartwarming experience...Major: A story that touches every Indian heart," Allu further tweeted.

385.title: Maharashtra will do whatever is possible for Kashmiri Pandits: CM
385.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Saturday said that his government will do whatever is possible for Kashmiri Pandits. "We will not leave them in the lurch," Thackeray added. "Maharashtra will stand firmly with them," he stated. Meanwhile, Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray, CM’s son, said that the situation in Kashmir is "deeply concerning".

386.title: PMC starts drive to give away saplings at ₹5 on World Environment Day
386.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is starting a drive on Sunday, on the occasion of World Environment Day, to give away native saplings like Jamun, Ashoka, Neem etc at a minimal cost of ₹5. A 'Van Mahotsav' has been organised at Sambhaji Raje Udyan. With an aim to distribute 80,000 saplings, the drive will continue till August 15.

387.title: Mercedes to recall 1 million older cars worldwide over possible faulty brakes
387.article_body: Mercedes-Benz is recalling nearly a million older cars worldwide due to a possible problem with the braking system, said the company on Saturday. It added that models of the ML, GL (BR 164) and R-Class (BR 251) series produced between 2004 and 2015 will be affected. As per the federal transport authority, worldwide 9,93,407 vehicles were being recalled.

388.title: Residents face 11-hour power outage in Pune's Sadashiv Peth
388.article_body: Residents in Pune's Sadashiv Peth on Saturday faced an 11-hour power outage in the area from 10 am. A Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (MSEDCL) official said that the power cut was due to multiple faults in the cables amid digging in the area. Due to the power cut, offices were also unable to function.

389.title: Who won what at IIFA awards 2022?
389.article_body: Vicky Kaushal was named the Best Actor at IIFA awards 2022 for his role in 'Sardar Udham', while Kriti Sanon bagged the Best Actress award for her role in 'Mimi'. 'Shershaah' was named Best Film, while 'Shershaah' director Vishnuvaradhan bagged the Best Director award. Sai Tamhankar and Pankaj Tripathi won the Best Supporting Actress and Best Supporting Actor awards, respectively.

390.title: US President Biden evacuated from beach home after plane enters restricted airspace
390.article_body: A small private airplane mistakenly entered restricted airspace near US President Joe Biden's Delaware beach home on Saturday, prompting the brief evacuation of the President and the First Lady. The White House said there was no threat to Biden or his family and that precautionary measures were taken. After the situation was assessed, they returned to the beach home.

391.title: Big B shared TVF video; we took screenshots & shared on our group: Jitendra
391.article_body: Actor Jitendra Kumar recalled that actor Amitabh Bachchan once shared a sketch video made by TVF on Twitter. Jitendra said that the team members took screenshots of Bachchan sharing video and shared it on their group. "That's when we realised this could be a series," he said, adding, "Gajraj [Rao] sir killed it in the sketch and it went viral."

392.title: Tesla headcount will increase, salaried to be fairly flat: Musk after job cuts email
392.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Sunday tweeted that the company's total headcount would increase over the next 12 months but the salaried staff "should be fairly flat". Musk was replying to a Twitter user who said Tesla's headcount would increase over the next year. His tweet comes days after he reportedly emailed his staff about 10% job cuts at Tesla.

393.title: Gangster-turned-politician Mukhtar Ansari's bail plea rejected
393.article_body: A local court in Lucknow rejected gangster-turned-politician Mukhtar Ansari's bail plea in connection with a 2020 land grab case. Special Judge Gaurav Kumar said, "The possibility that he would influence the witnesses during the trial cannot be ruled out." Ansari's bail application claimed that he was innocent and was implicated in the case due to political rivalry.

394.title: 17th-century monastery hit by Russian artillery in Ukraine: Prez
394.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that Russian artillery had hit a 17th-century Ukrainian Orthodox monastery in eastern Ukraine on Saturday, engulfing a church in flames. However, Russia has denied any involvement in the incident and accused the Ukrainian troops of setting the church on fire before pulling back. Ukraine has repeatedly accused Russia of targeting civilians amid the war.

395.title: Simply amazing: Alcaraz to Swiatek after her French Open title win
395.article_body: Reacting to world number one Iga Swiatek's 2022 French Open title win, world number six men's tennis player Carlos Alcaraz congratulated her, saying, "Simply amazing." World number six Ons Jabeur, who lost in the first round of women's singles at the French Open, tweeted, "Congrats Swiatek, incredible really." Notably, it is Swiatek's sixth consecutive title in 2022.

396.title: Situation in Kashmir is deeply concerning: Aaditya Thackeray
396.article_body: Speaking about the recent killings in Kashmir, Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray called the situation in the valley "deeply concerning". He said, "It is unfortunate that the situation is repeating in these times again. We expect the Government of India to take strong measures to ensure their protection." Kashmir has reportedly witnessed at least eight killings since May 1, 2022.

397.title: Rare natural pearl necklace sold for ₹6.25 cr at online auction, pic released
397.article_body: A rare natural pearl necklace has been auctioned for ₹6.25 crore at an AstaGuru online auction. The necklace, which was part of the Mumbai-based auction house's 'Heirloom Jewellery, Silver, and Timepieces' collection, has natural, salt-water pearls, faceted crystal discs and a golden clasp set with old cut diamonds. It's said to be an extremely rare find due to its size.

398.title: Mahindra shares pic of his father's 77-year-old application to US college
398.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra shared pictures of his father Harish Mahindra's application to Tufts University's The Fletcher School in 1945. "So proud to read my father's audacious aspiration and bold statement while India was still a British colony," he wrote. In the application, his father had written why he had chosen Foreign Service as his professional aim.

399.title: I've torn several lateral ligaments in my right foot: World no. 3 Zverev
399.article_body: World number three Alexander Zverev took to Instagram to give an update on his ankle injury, which forced him to withdraw from 2022 French Open semi-final against Rafael Nadal. "Based on the first medical checks, it looks like I've torn several lateral ligaments in my right foot. I'll be flying to Germany on Monday to make further examinations."

400.title: Cong doesn't recognise workers: Punjab ex-minister on joining BJP
400.article_body: Former Punjab minister Balbir Singh Sidhu criticised Congress after he joined BJP and said Congress does not 'recognise its workers'. "I have been in Congress since I was 30-32 years old...(I've) worked with all my blood and sweat for the party," he said. Sidhu, along with three former Congress ministers and two SAD leaders joined BJP on Saturday.

401.title: US & S Korea conclude military drills amid tensions with N Korea
401.article_body: South Korea and the US concluded a three-day military exercise on Saturday, amid tensions with North Korea. Notably, this the first combined exercise between the two countries involving an American aircraft carrier in over four years. The tensions stem from the recent missile launches by North Korea and reports of the North Korean government preparing to conduct a nuclear test.
